Yolanda M. is from the town of Palagao Jones. She is 49 years old. Yolanda is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yolanda M. Group.

Yolanda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP whenever she sells her raised animal.

In 2006, Yolanda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Yolanda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa B. lives in the village of Jasaan in the province of Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells food and other items people need daily. She has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2009, Gaudiosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI and is now applying for a new one for 10,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to continue expanding it. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Yoeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun C. is the 67-year-old leader of this group loan, having been selected by its four members located in Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal Province. The members will use the loan to buy supplies, equipment and other items to support their various purposes.

Yoeun and her husband, Mr. Yin Long, are rice wine makers, and she also breeds pigs at home, a business for which she is requesting a loan to buy pig food. Yoeun is a mother of two children, one of whom is a student in the local school, while the other is 5 years old.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc”, tiene 40 años y tiene dos hijos. 

Su actividad económica principal es la venta de cereales, verduras y hortalizas. Luisa lleva sus productos a la ciudad del Cusco al mercado de Huancaro los días sábados y al mercado de Wanchaq los días lunes. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar productos como por ejemplo cereales como quinua, tarwi, trigo, etc. Ella vive en la comunidad de Rayanniyoc del distrito de Taray de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. Los pobladores de la comunidad se dedican a la ganadería y agricultura.
texts.en:
Luisa belongs to the “Villa Rayanniyoc” communal bank. She is 40 years old and has two children. Her main economic activity is selling grains and vegetables. Luisa takes her products to the city of Cusco, to the Huancaro market on Saturdays, and to the Wanchaq market on Mondays. She needs the loan to buy more products, for instance grains such as quinua, tarwi [a kind of lupin], wheat, etc. She lives in the community of Rayanniyoc, in Taray district, Calca province, Department of Cusco. The inhabitants of this community raise livestock and work in agriculture.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products including grains such as quinua, tarwi, wheat, etc.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert B. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal East, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 27 years old. Robert is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Robert owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport services. Robert has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Robert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robert has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Robert is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicles for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Robert from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of revenue for Mary Jane R. and her family. They usually plant and harvest rice for sale. Mary Jane has been engaged in the business for over six years and earns approximately 35,000 PHP per harvest. She and her family are happily living in the village of Manaoag. She is 39 years old. Mary Jane is married and has two school-aged children. According to Mary Jane, she really values her business. It is a big help in supporting their needs, especially the educational needs of her children.

In 2008, Mary Jane joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Recognizing the benefit of the loan to her business, Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 24,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Mary Jane from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela es una agradable mujer de 48 años de edad, ella vive con su hija Pamela de 21 años y su nieto Cristopher de tan solo cuatro años de edad. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Ella se dedica desde hace ya 3 años en la venta de ropa, actividad que le ha dado grandes gratificaciones pues es una actividad tranquila que puede realizar en sus momentos libres, pues debe cuidar a su nieto. Graciela anteriormente trabajó en la venta de verduras pero enfermó y tuvo que dedicarse a una actividad más tranquila, es por ello que se siente contenta con su nueva actividad. Su forma de trabajo consiste en ir de casa en casa a ofrecer su mercadería tanto a vecinas y amigas, de esa manera asegura una buena venta. En un futuro ha pensado poner un bazar en su casa y este proyecto también la ayudará su hija. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y promete ser muy puntual con el pago de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar mayor cantidad de calcetines y otras prendas, para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Graciela, 48, is a friendly woman. She lives with her 21-year old daughter, Pamela, and her grandson, Christopher, who is 4-years old. They live together in a house that Graciela owns. For 3 years, she has operated a business selling clothing, work that gives her a lot of satisfaction because it is relatively relaxed and she can work at it when she is not caring for young Christopher. Graciela once worked selling vegetables but she had to give it up when she became ill. She had to find a new business so she was happy to find this one. She sells by going door to door, to friends and neighbors, because that's the best way to ensure sales. For the future, she is thinking of setting up a stall in her house, a project that will also help her daughter. This is Graciela's second MFP loan and she is committed to repaying it on time. She will use the loan to buy wholesale supplies of socks and other clothing items to meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Nusa Sejahtera Group

texts.en: I Wayan N. is a 60-year-old male living in the town of Melaya, Bali. He is the group leader of this six-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nusa Sejahtera (PK-10266). I Wayan N. is married and has two adult children. He owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. He has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month. In 2008, I Wayan N. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from MUK. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. I Wayan N. is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be his 3rd from MUK. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. ***************************************************** I Wayan N. 0 (0) merupakan 60 tahun pria. Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. I Wayan N. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 6 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Nusa Sejahtera (PK-10266). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. I Wayan N. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 11 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, I Wayan N. menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR. Dalam 2008, I Wayan N. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. I Wayan N. telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,500,000 IDR dari MUK. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more car parts for her husband's shop

loans.name: No Joke Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “No Joke” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the northern township of Magburaka. They are requesting a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in the group.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. 

Aminata K. K. is the leader of this group. Aminata was born in Matotoka village, about eight miles from Magburaka town. She is thirty-five years old, married to a driver, and they have three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school.  Aminata will use her share of the loan to buy palm oil, rice and groundnuts to add to her business inventory. Aminata has been selling the above-mentioned items for ten years now.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, rice and groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Ruhim

texts.ru:
Ruhim A. 30 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey, sin kotoromu 5 let i doch kotoroy 3 qoda. Ruhim yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione, poselok Bala Behmenli vmeste s semyoy. 

Ruhim  uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom skotovodstva. Eto uje vtoroy ssud Rihima v perviy raz on  bral 1000$ ,za etu ssudu on ochen blagodaren lenderam. Seychas je kak vi videte na fotoqrafii Ruhin imeyet noviy svoy bizness i seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya biznessa.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/7355
texts.en:
Ruhim A. is 30 years old.  He is married and has 2 children: 5-year son and 3-year-old daughter.  Ruhim is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the Fuzuli region and now lives in the Bala Behmenli village in the Fuzuli region together with his family.

Ruhim has been involved in the animal husbandry business for 2 years.  This is Ruhim's second loan.  He first borrowed $1000 and is very grateful to the lenders for this credit.  Currently, as you can see in the photograph, Ruhim has a new business and needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cattle for developing his business.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
José J. nasceu em Manica, uma Província do centro de Moçambique, onde concluiu o ensino primário, tem filhos e estudam. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Transfere-se para Maputo na década 80 em missão de serviço, tem um salário mensal fixo que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.

Através do seu serviço soube da existência da Hluvuku e já solicitou 4 empréstimos com os quais legalizou o seu terreno, comprou materiais de construção e iniciou a sua obra, tendo melhorado significativamente a sua vida pelo que já tem uma casa condigna.

Com actual empréstimo e primeiro no Kiva no valor de 16.500.00mt pretende comprar materiais de construção (cimento, areia e pagamento de mão de obra) para continuar com a sua obra.
O seu sonho futuro é comprar um carro, iniciar um negócio e para concretizar os seus projectos vai recorrer a outros empréstimos da Hluvuku/kiva.
texts.en:
José J. was born in Manica, in Central Mozambique, where he finished elementary school. He lives with his family in a house they own and has children who are enrolled in school. 

He was transferred to Maputo for work in the 1980s. His current salary pays for household expenses and allows him to save some money in the bank.
He learned about Hluvuku through work, and his previous four loans with the institution were used to buy the land for his house and construction material to start building it.

José will use his current loan, in the amount of 16.500.00mt, to buy more cement, sand and to pay for labor to continue the house construction. He plans to apply for more Hluvuku/Kiva loans in the future to buy a car and start his own business.

loans.use: compra de materiais de construção (cimento, areia e pagamento de mão de obra)

loans.name: Nyabugando Farmers Association-Rukungiri Group

texts.en: Cledonia M. is 31 years old and married with three children. She belongs to the Nyabugando Farmers Group-Rukungiri. She has been operating an agricultural business in Kitazigurukaha for two years. Cledonia began her business after completing training from the national agricultural advisory services. She will use her loan to improve her poultry farm.

loans.use: to improve poultry farm

loans.name: Sea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sea V., age 44, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from other fisherman. She currently earns an average of US$2.80 per day. She has been running her business for several years. Her husband is 53 years old and is a fisherman who works along a local river. He is also a motor taxi driver. Mrs. Sea V. is the mother of one young child. 

In order earn extra profit, Mrs. Sea V.’s husband planted some banana trees behind his home, and he often sells bananas in the local market. He uses his motorbike as transportation, but can only carry his products in small amounts. That affects how he can satisfy the needs of his customers. Because of this problem, Mrs. Sea V. decided to request a loan for her husband in order to purchase a trailer to attach to his motorcycle. This would allow him to transport larger amounts of his product than is currently possible.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for carrying product to market

loans.name: Maria Abigail

texts.es:
Maria Abigail de es soltera, labora para el MINED desde hace 20 años como docente de primaria en una escuela de Santo Domingo, Chontales. 

Esta solicitando  su 9no credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa levantando una pared y cambiando el techo de su casa que esta en mal estado y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.  

Cabe señalar que sus creditos anteriores los ha invertido en mejorar su casita, pero hasta ahora espera ser beneficiada con kiva.
texts.en:
Maria Abigail is single.  She has worked for MINED for 20 years as an elementary school teacher in a school in Santo Domingo, Chontales.

She is requesting her 9th loan so that she can improve her house by building a wall and replacing her roof which is in a bad state.  She hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

We must point out that Maria Abigail invested her previous loans in improving her house.  She now hopes to benefit from Kiva loans.

loans.use: To repair walls

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emilia; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como perfumes,lápiz labiales,cremas para el rostro y entre otros,ella vende en forma independiente ofreciendo al publico en general. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Emilia belongs to the “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Emilia is 52 years old, single, and she has two children.  She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling beauty products like perfume, lipstick, and face creams, among others.  She sells in an independent manner to the general public. 

She is requesting the loan to buy beauty products wholesale.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy beauty products wholesale

loans.name: Raghda

texts.en:
Raghda is married and has no children. Her husband, a National Palestinian Authority employee, is having a problem in his wrist and he requires surgery. Raghda came to FATEN and took out a loan to pay for part of the cost of the surgery as they don't have enough money to pay the entire amount at once.

Raghda's husband appears in the photo as Raghda is a religious woman and didn't want her picture posted online.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's health expenses

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 50-year-old widow who supports her family by operating one business venture selling Avon products. She lives in Tanjay City in the province of Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000, and she has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business selling Avon products, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 10,000 PHP.

Josefina is borrowing 22,000 PHP to enable her to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Josefina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in his wife’s fish and chicken business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: El Sr. Fernando es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar y  tiene 29 años D. edad,  actualmente asume el cargo D. presidente  en L. alcancía comunal “Unidos para triunfar” grupo  conformado por 10 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Fernando trabaja con Edaprospo desD. hace tres 3, Fernando  trabaja desD. hace 10 años en una bodega que  inauguro con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo, este trabajo surge  a raíz D. que sus hijos ingresaban al colegio y él deseaba darles lo mejor y sobre todo estabilidad,  es así que hoy en día a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, que le ha permitido construir su casa, comprarse dos terrenos  y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida, con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar  mercadería y ampliar su negocio.  Sabemos que Fernando  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
29 year-old Fernando lives with his partner and has 2 school-age children.  He is currently the president of the 'Unidos para Triunfar' community bank.  This group has 10 members who work in different businesses.

Fernando has been working with Edaprospo for 3 years.  For the past 10 years, he has been working in a small grocery store that he set up with a lot of hard work and effort.  He started out in this line of work because his children were entering high school and he wanted to proviD. them with the best.  Above all, he wanted to proviD. them with stability.  He has managed to improve his income and this has enabled him to build his own home, buy two plots of land, and proviD. his family with a better quality of life.  In order to continue growing in his business, he has requested a new loan to buy merchandise and expand his business.  We know that Fernando will achieve his goals with a lot of hard work and effort.  His loans from Edaprospo will help him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mourn

texts.en:
Mr. Mourn N. and his wife, Mrs. Yin Tiev (pictured together) are fruit sellers. They buy fruit from their fellow villagers on contract before harvesting. When the harvesting season comes they take the fruits to sell to a middleman who comes to buy at their house. The couple asked for a Kiva loan once, they now are requesting another loan of $1,200 to purchase additional fruits under contract for resale. 

The family lives along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to purchase fruits under contract for resale

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 48 years old and is married with 4 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 10 years and earns additional income from a sari-sari store (convenience store).

Adelina has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy hog feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del banco comunal “Visión al Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Coronel. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano, en la feria los días viernes, durante toda la jornada. Sus ventas varían según la mercadería que tenga para ofrecer.
María se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 8 años y comenzó con éste, debido a la enfermedad de su hija, quien padece de fibrosis quística al páncreas, por lo que su comienzo en el rubro del comercio fue bastante difícil y sacrificado, ya que debió comenzar de cero, para costear los medicamentos y controles médicos de su hija. En sus inicios vendía rifas, pero esto no lograba costear en su magnitud los gastos médicos que se le demandaban, por lo que comenzó a vender ropas en desuso de su propia casa y posteriormente empezó a juntar dinero para comprar fardos de ropa. En la actualidad su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago, específicamente fardos de ropa de segunda mano.
Con el préstamo comprará 15 fardos de ropa; específicamente pantalones, ropa interior, ropa de niños y ropa de casa.
Sus metas son tener un local establecido para ofrecer y vender su mercadería (ropa), además de contar con un vehículo que le permita trasladar su mercadería a los sectores rurales y periféricos de la ciudad, para vender su mercadería a las personas que no tienen la facilidad de trasladarse a la ciudad.
María vive junto a su esposo, sus tres hijos de 20, 17 y 15 años de edad y además tiene el cuidado personal de uno de sus sobrinos quien tiene 8 años de edad. Sus hijos son quienes le ayudan en su negocio, ya sea en el traslado de mercadería, instalar su puesto en la feria  y planchar la ropa que proviene de los fardos comprados. 
Sus motivaciones de continuar y superarse en su negocio es debido a la ayuda que le otorga a su familia, específicamente a sus hijos. 
María está muy contenta y agradecida de Fondo Esperanza, ya que afirma que sin su apoyo no podría continuar con su negocio, debido al apoyo y crédito. Además participa activamente de las reuniones del banco comunal y ha podido generar lazos de amistad en el grupo. Respecto a los cursos que se imparten en las reuniones ha podido incorporar estos aprendizajes en su propio negocio. 
Coronel es una comuna ubicada al sur de Chile, cerca de la ciudad de Concepción, región del Bíobío. Posee una economía basada en servicios, explotación forestal, agricultura. Cuenta también con una importante tradición minera en carbón, actividad que ya no se realiza, pero de la cual quedó la mina de carbón “Chiflón Puchoco”, convertida ahora en museo minero.
texts.en:
Maria is part of the “Visión al Futuro” communal bank in the city of Coronel.  She sells second hand clothing at the fair all day on Fridays.  Her sales vary depending on the merchandise she has to offer on a given day.

María has been doing this for eight years and began because her daughter had gotten sick with pancreatic cystic fibrosis.  Starting from scratch was difficult and involved many sacrifices because she also had to pay for her daughter’s medicines.  She started out selling raffle tickets, but it didn’t bring in enough money, so she began selling second-hand clothing out of her home and began saving up to buy packs of clothing.  Now she buys her merchandise, packs of clothing, in Santiago.

She will use the money from this loan to buy 15 packs, specifically pants, undergarments, children’s and house clothes. 
Her goals are to have a local establishment to be able to offer and sell her merchandise (clothing), and to also have a vehicle that will allow her to transport the clothing to different parts of the city, and be able to sell to those who do not have their own transportation.
María lives with her husband and three children, ages 20, 17, and 15, and also cares for one of her nephews who is eight years old.  Her children help her to transport the clothing to the fair, set up the stall and iron the clothes from the packs.

Her motivations to continue and to succeed in her business are the help she gets from her family, especially her children.
María is very happy and grateful to Fondo Ezperanza and affirms that without their support she would not have been able to continue with her business.  She also actively participates in the communal bank meetings, has been able to make ties off friendship with the group, and has been able to put her new knowledge to work in her business.

Coronel is a community located in southern Chile, near Concepción, in the Bíobío region.  Its economy is based on forestry product extraction and agriculture.  It also has an important coal mining tradition, but the “Chiflón Puchoco mine is no longer active and has been converted into a museum.

loans.use: to buy packs of clothing for resale

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Малаева Мухаббат проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Её муж и старший сын находятся в Российской Федерации. Сама Мухаббат занимается растениеводством. Она арендует участок земли, где выращивает овощи и сеет рис для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 5 лет. Кредит для закупа топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян риса.
texts.en: Muhabbat M. lives in Shahrituz. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband and oldest son are in the Russian Federation. Muhabbat is a farmer. She rents a plot of land where she grows vegetables and rice for sale. She has been doing this for five years. She is taking out a loan to buy fuel, mineral fertilizer, and rice seed.

loans.use: Для закупа топлива, минеральных удобрений и семян риса

loans.name: Joseph S.k.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the teachers of the SLMB Primary School Upper, situated in Mile Ninety One, a small town in the Tonkolili district in northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 7,200,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, some of these teachers will invest in businesses, while others will pay school fees for their children, and so on. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar is directly responsible for repaying SMT on these borrowers’ behalf. 

Joseph is a teacher at the school and the leader of this group. The 48-year-old has been in the teaching profession for twenty-three years now. A native of Mile Ninety One town, Joseph is married and has four children. Joseph has requested a loan of 2,700,000 SLL in order to pay school fees for his children. 

(Attached to this photo are snapshots of Mohamed and Mamusu, borrowers who were not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Jaime Luis

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 37 años de edad, es un hombre soltero y sin hijos. Vive en casa propia en una comunidad humilde y pequeña del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura. Cliente vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz agua y desagüe. Jaime es conocido por ser una persona honrada y trabajadora.

Jaime se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, actualmente cuenta con 23 ovejas las cuales al alcanzar tamaño y peso ideal las comercializa en el mercado local. Jaime tiene una experiencia de 5 años en la ganadería. Además, Jaime es el actual Alcalde de la Municipalidad Delegada de Malingas,  en su mismo distrito y es una persona muy querida por lo habitantes de esta comunidad.

Jaime solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus ovejas, así como para mejoras en su vivienda y uso personal. Sus padres son agricultores y clientes conocidos de Edpyme Alternativa tienen un muy buen récord de pagos. Jaime también es un cliente conocido de nuestra institución y su anterior crédito fue KIVA y lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
Jaime, 37, is single and lives in a house he owns in Tambogrande-Piura.  The house is in a rural area and lacks basic services like water, electricity and sewage.

Jaime is known to be an honorable, hard-working man.  He operates a business, raising and selling sheep.  He has 23 sheep now that he will sell at a local market once they reach the ideal size and weight for sale.  Jaime has raised and sold animals for 5 years.  He is also the mayor of the town of Delegada de Malingas, a man widely respected by the people of the town.

Jaime is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new soles loan that he will use to buy supplies of animal feed for his livestock business, improve his house and meet personal expenses.  His parents are farmers and Edpyme Alternativa clients, with a good record of repaying their loans.  Jaime, too, is known to the bank and has a history of repaying past loans on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his livestock business and for personal expenses.

loans.name: Sokorn

texts.en:
Sokorn, 32 years old, is a garment factory worker. Her husband sells ice-cream. Their income is $8 per day. They have a 6 year old child who goes to school. Every month, Sokorn has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. 

Sokorn would like to request a loan of $1000 to purchase some female pigs to sell. Her income is a bit small and she needs to get more money to support the family. The increased income is important, especially for her child to school. She needs to get another career to help her family. She wants to feed more pigs in the future to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed at home.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: La señora Sabina tiene 40 años de edad, es casada su esposo se dedica a cargar materiales en volquetes(vehículo de carga pesada), tiene 3 hijos que están en edad escolar, sabina se dedica a vender golosinas gaseosas entre otros en un triciclo de manera ambulatoria,sabina antes trabajaba vendiendo verduras pero decidió trabajar en otro rubro que es la ventas de golosinas con la cual genera mas ingresos, ya tiene trabajando 4 años en esta actividad, el dinero que esta solicitando es para comprar otro triciclo para que uno de sus hijos la apoye vendiendo golosinas y así generar mas ingresos para su familia, sabina tiene mucho sueños uno de ellos es ampliar mas su negocio y en un futuro no muy lejano tener su propio local, sabina esta muy agradecida con la confianza que se le esta brindando.
texts.en: Sabina is 40 years old and married. Her husband works carrying materials in trucks (heavy cargo vehicles). She has 3 school-aged children. Sabina works selling snacks, soft drinks and other items from a three-wheeled cart as a mobile vendor. Sabina used to work selling vegetables, but she decided to work in another field, selling snacks, which would generate more income for her. She has been working for 4 years in this area, and the funds she is requesting are to buy another three-wheeled cart so that one of her children can help her sell snacks and thus generate more income for the family. Sabina has many dreams, and one of them is to keep expanding her business, and in the not-so-distant future to have her own shop. Sabina is very grateful for the confidence that is being placed in her.

loans.use: to buy another 3-wheeled cart to expand her business.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
This is Irenea, 52, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Ignacio, a farmer, and a mother of three children, all of whom are married. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Irenea operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Irenea buys supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Aside from the variety store, she sells fruits, rice and processed meat products. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 425 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages, as well as processed meat products and rice to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Irenea hopes to be able to expand soon and to be in good health always. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her store.

loans.name: Vilmer

texts.en:
As a responsible father, Vilmer aims to improve their status of living through his farming activity. He is 31 years old and has two school-age children. He has been a farmer for almost five years, earning an average net profit of PHP 35,000 every harvest season from this activity.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for the labor cost spent in planting rice in the field. He hopes that he will harvest a better yield next crop season to increase his income to help him support his family needs sufficiently. He believes that his strong faith and determination will lead him to reach his goals in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides and pay for the labor costs

location.town: Brgy. Bitnong, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Pucaray De Huancalle Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUCARAY DE HUANCALLE”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Pisac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la señora Marleni; la socia es soltera y tiene 26 años de edad, la socia tiene 1 hijo; la socia trabaja elaborando anticuchos , los cuales los vende en las tardes hasta altas horas de la noche, la socia compra carne de vacuno en buenas cantidades los cuales los troza y los condimenta con especies que las pasa una por una en numero de 4 pedazos de carnes y en la punta del palito llamado brocheta insertar una papa cocida, esta es cocinada en una parrilla y acompañada de un preparado especial llamado uchucuta, en quechua y en castellano seria rocoto molido con especias. Lo cual es vendido por unidades a partir de las 6 de la tarde hasta las 12 de la noche. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de carne y de ingredientes, mas en la compra de un par de sillas plásticas para mejorar la atención e incrementar su pequeño negocio, la venta es en la esquina comercial de su barrio, en la parte de la vereda ella se instala todas las tardes de forma ambulatoria y a la intemperie. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de carne, especias, sillas de plástico para los clientes.

Los otros socios del banco se dedican a la venta de verduras, venta de hortalizas, venta de comidas de forma ambulatoria, venta de productos secos, crianza de animales menores, como cuyes, chanchos, aves de corral. Otros socios se dedican al transporte.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “PUCARAY DE HUANCALLE” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Pisac in the district of Pisac, province and department of Cuzco.   

The members name is Marleni. She is single and 26 years old and has 1 son. She makes "anticuchos" [kebobs] which she sells in the evening until late at night. She buys beef in large quantities which she cuts up and seasons with spices. She places four pieces of meat on a skewer with a cooked potato and grills it to serve with a side dish called "uchucuta" in Quechua, ground rocoto pepper with spices. She sells from six  in the evening until 12 at night. She needs the loan to invest in buying meat and other ingredients. She also needs to buy a couple of plastic chairs to improve her service in grow her small business. She sells on a commercial corner of her neighborhood on the sidewalk. She sets up every afternoon and sells as a street vendor outdoors. She needs the loan to invest in buying meat, spices, and plastic chairs for her customers. 

The other members of the bank sell vegetables and herbs, are street vendors of food, sell dry goods, raise small animals such as guinea pigs, pigs, and poultry. Others work in transportation.

Marleni is grateful for the support that has been given to her and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to invest in buying meat, spices, and plastic chairs for her customers.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 27-year-old married woman with 2 young children aged 6 and 4. Marites and her husband are both farmers. They grow and sell rice. Marites's husband mainly manages their rice farm and she spends time selling dried fish to their neighborhood and taking care of her children. 

Marites has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: 3.9.82 Thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs Tính operates a food stall where she sells fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Tính is 43 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 3.9.82 Thiệu D. solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Tính joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tính has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tính has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tính D. faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tính hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She wants her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Bella Haidee

texts.es:
Bella es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos. Comenzó el negocio hace años atrás para poder mejorar  sus ingresos. También vende comida los fines de semana para tener un ingreso adicional para sus dos hijos ya que es madre soltera. 

En la actualidad trabaja de lunes a viernes en su negocio de comercio y los fines de semana con la venta de comida. Tiene muchas proyecciones en el futuro por eso quiere mejorar sus ingresos y el de sus hijos haciendo un préstamo  para comprar perfumes, ropa y joyas. En el futuro quiere mejorar su vivienda y tener un negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Bella is a hard-working woman who has a business selling clothes and cosmetics.  She started this business several years ago, in order to be able to improve her income.  She also sells food on the weekends to bring in additional income for her two children, as she is a single mother.

She currently works from Monday through Friday in her retail business, and on the weekends selling food.  She has many plans for the future as she wants to improve her income for her family, so she is taking a loan to buy perfume, clothing and jewelry.

In the future, she would like to improve her home and have a well-established business.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfume.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old and is married with 5 children. With 2 children in school, Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Grace runs a Sari-sari Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell. Grace has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, rice and other groceries. 

In the future Grace would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Jojo

texts.en:
Jojo believes, that "a hard working person will become successful in the future ". He is 29 years old and still single. Due to financial difficulties, he did not pursue his college education, he decided to work and help his parents in financing the education of his younger brothers and sisters. He is engaged in vegetable production to generates income. 

He aims to plant more vegetables to increase his yield and income but due to lack of capital, he is asking for a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He believes that this loan will help a lot to increase his production and income. He hopes that in the future, he will save up more income and start his own business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for vegetable production

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, has four children and earns a living by making and selling furniture such as cabinets, closets and tables. She has been in this business for the last five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy the materials she needs to make more items to sell to her customers. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009 and is committed to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials to make more furniture to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rene Amilcar

texts.es:
René, vive con su esposa y sus hijos, tienen casa propia, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, este negocio lo inicio hace 7 años, con la ayuda de su familia.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos frescos, pescado, camarones, langostas, ostras, conchas y más mariscos del gusto de los clientes, esta inversión mejorara la disponibilidad en el negocio, abriendo más puertas a través del manejo de este crédito, para futuras inversiones.
Su aspiración es que el negocio sea más rentable, que aumenten los ingresos para su familia y tener más oportunidades de crecimiento.
texts.en:
René lives with his wife and children in a house that they own. He sells shellfish. He has been doing this job for seven years, with the assistance of his family.
He is asking for this loan in order to buy fresh supplies such as fish, shrimp, lobsters, oysters, conch and other shellfish that his customers would enjoy. This investment will improve the availability of fish in his business. This loan will open new doors to future opportunities.
Rene desires a more profitable business. This loan will improve his earnings, which will benefit his family and allow his business to grow.

loans.use: to buy fresh products such as fish, shrimp, oysters and lobster.

loans.name: Namulanda A Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Namulanda A Group in Western Kenya! Metrine is the facilitator of the Namulanda A group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Metrine takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Metrine had a good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Metrine was only able to harvest six bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Metrine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Metrine will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Namulanda A group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Luis Floriberto

texts.es:
Luis es una persona de 28 años es responsable y le gusta trabajar en la agricultura. Tiene dos hijos de 3 y 1 años de edad. Vive con su familia en San Gabriel que está en la Provincia del Carchi.

Luis trabaja en la siembra de papas, también en la compra venta de papas, en este negocio lleva ya ocho años.  Es el cuarto crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de materiales de fumigación para curar su cultivo de papas ya que puede dañarse por el mal tiempo y tendría grandes pérdidas.

Su sueño es tener un terreno grande para incrementar su producción y poder montar una microempresa de venta de papas con esto obtendrá muy buenos ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Luis is a responsible 28-year old, and he likes to work in agriculture. He has two children aged 3 and 1. He lives with his family in San Gabriel, which is in the province of Carchi.

Luis cultivates potatoes and also buys and sells potatoes. He has been in this business for eight years already. This is the fourth credit that he has requested from Fodemi, and it will be used to buy materials for spraying to treat his potato crop, since it can be harmed by the bad weather and he would have large losses.

His dream is to have a large piece of land to increase his production and to be able to start up a potato-selling micro-enterprise; with this, he would obtain very good income.

loans.use: to buy spraying materials as he wants to treat his potato crop, since he could lose it.

loans.name: Winelyn

texts.en:
Winelyn is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Winelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Winelyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Neza

texts.en:
Neza is 24 years old and married, with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Neza has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy bamboo, a fishing net, binders, and other fishing materials.

Neza has been in this business for three years. In the future, Neza would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, a fishing net, binders, and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Madam Diana A. is a textiles dealer. she lives within the community of 21,000 inhabitants. Sixty percent of these inhabitants are women and children who patronise the shop of Madam A. to buy their school uniforms and church and other social dresses. The Yehowa Nti shop is the local shopping avenue where prices are moderately cheap. Because of the moderate prices the shop owner enjoys alot more patronage. The shop owner Madam A. is an aluminus of Kraban\'s TEACH lending programs. She has prepared a business in marketing plan. She also keeps basic accounting and book keeping records. She needs a loan amount of $800 from KIVA funds.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Holger

texts.en:
Holger is a young farmer who still works the lands with his parents. He and his father operate a farm where they only grow rice. They are in need of capital to purchase the necessary materials to sustain the crop, like fertilizer and pesticides. Holger is not married, nor does he have any children. His short term goal is to make the lands of his family as productive as possible while accumulating some savings. He hopes he can study agronomy in the near future if he has sufficient money and luck.

The Paypayales Communal Bank in Santa Lucia

Holger is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program: the Paypayales Communal Bank. All bank members are part of a rice farmers' cooperative in Santa Lucia named Dios Con Nosotros (God is with us). They will use these microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. As members of a communal bank, they are all the guarantors for each other's loans. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Dios con Nosotros Cooperative are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about the commnity of Santa Lucia, compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The region is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them harvest their crop. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not have access to formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also often lack skills and knowledge of how to commercialize their product and get fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them to repay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Buy materials for rice farming

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim V. is a 44-year-old native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He currently lives in Aghsu city with his wife and two children. He has spent almost the last 20 years running a small repair shop where he repairs refrigerators and other household appliances. Ibrahim, seeing the benefits of credit, is requesting his first loan with Normicro for $575 in order to purchase new tools and other materials needed in his repair shop.

loans.use: To purchase materials and tools for his repair shop

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio lives in a rented place located on the Jaime Zudañes Street, Tembladerani zone in the city of La Paz. He is 50 years old and is separated from his wife. He lives with his three daughters, two of them are minors who depend on him.

He has a woodworking shop located in his lot at the Pasankeri zone(west side of the city of La Paz). With the first loans that Impro provided him, he installed the small shop, the same one that toady is much bigger because of machinery and two employees that work with him as master carpenter and his assistant. Besides constructing furniture, he contracts with construction companies.

Patricio is a client since the year 2000 (he has been granted 8 loans already). His credit history qualifies him as good client and grants him access to a new loan. This new loan will be invested in buying raw materials (wood) to elaborate his products

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Translator

Patricio vive en alquiler en la calle Jaime Zudañes de la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, esta separado de la esposa y tiene 50 años de edad , vive con sus tres hijas dos de ellas menores de edad y dependientes de él.

Tiene un taller de carpintería que esta ubicado en un terreno de su propiedad en la zona de Pasankeri (ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz). Con los primeros créditos otorgados por Impro, instalo su pequeño taller el mismo que actualmente es mas grande, y ya cuenta con maquinaria y trabaja con dos empleados: un maestro carpintero y su ayudante. Además de elaborar muebles realiza contratos con empresas constructoras.

Es cliente desde el año 2000 (ha recibido ya 8 créditos), y sus antecedentes históricos lo califica como buen cliente y lo habilitan para acceder a un nuevo crédito. El nuevo credito sera destinado a la compra de materia prima (madera) para la elaboración de sus productos.

loans.use: Working capital for his carpentry and furniture business.

loans.name: Tasileta

texts.en: Tasileta is married and is 42 years of age. She has 2 children and three adopted children. Tasileta's husband is a farmer, and they have been in business for a long time. Tasileta decided to join SPBD because her husband wanted to have a plantation of their own. They moved away from their family owned plantation, and developed their own plantation. Her first loan she used to buy a back sprayer and some farm equipment, and they developed the plantation well. In the future, they plan to develop their plantation and to help it grow bigger.

loans.use: To assist with the family's plantation.

loans.name: Azizov

texts.en: E. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Lachin region located in the south-east part of Azerbaijan.  He and his family were relocated to the Binagadi settlement of Baku city as a result of the Armenian-Azerbaijan military conflict over Garabakh.  He rents a shop and trades vegetables, fruits and spices.  He has been in this business for more than 4 years. He now wants to increase his volume of sales as turnover is rather small, invest more in the business and increase his income.  He has now applied to Normicro Baku branch for the first time to borrow $1200 to invest in and expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital and expand his business

loans.name: Elvira A.

texts.es:
Client History: Elvira has a shop where she sews clothes for women, such as: blouses, jackets, suits and mending in general. Her home and shop are located in the Miraflores area in the city of La Paz.

This is the third time that she has asked for a loan. Her prior loans qualify her as a client; in other words, she has paid back her loans and fulfilled her obligation. The requested amount will be used to purchase prime materials like: fabric, linings, thread, zippers, trimmings and hooks and eyes. Her job allows her to request this loan, in that she already has experience as a seamstress and generates sufficient income to cover the loan and her particular needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Elvira tiene un taller donde realiza todo trabajo de costura para damas, como ser vestidos blusas, chamarras, trajes y arreglos en general. Su domicilio y taller se encuentra ubicado en la zona de miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la Tercera vez que solicita un crédito Su antecedente crediticio lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago se su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de materia prima (tela, forro, hilo, cierre, adornos, y broches) Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como costurera y genera ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y sus necesidades particulares.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her sewing shop.

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en: Josephine, the group leader, is 38 years old and married with five children. She sells charcoal and also has a small poultry farm. She intends to use the profits from her business to finish construction work on her house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transporting charcoal from rural areas to towns.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en: Alisher M.  lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan. In spite the fact that he is a young man (he is 22 years old) he is rather experienced in business. Mr.M. has recommended himself as a serious and reliable client. He is engaged in  livestock raising and selling. He has a large flock and the large barn. Now Mr.M. requests a loan of $650 to be repaid in  8 months for the barn completion. It  will permit  him to increase the size of his flock number.

loans.use: for a barn completion

loans.name: Chrouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Chrouk T. (pictured with her husband) and her husband married in 1963. They have six children: four sons and two daughters. Five of their children are married and live outside the family home and the youngest son lives under their roof and helps them in doing farming.

Mrs. Chrouk and her husband have been doing farming for almost thirty years. They grow cucumbers and other vegetables on the farm near their home. They are in their early 60s but still strong enough to work. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chrouk is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $300 for growing cucumbers.

loans.use: growing cucumbers

loans.name: Hauy

texts.en:
Hauy S. is 60 years old and lives in the Thmor Kor district of Kampong Cham province. Since 1979, she has been growing vegetables and rice to sustain her family. She also takes these vegetables to the markets to sell. She only earns 1 USD a day.

Her husband, Suon Sem, is also 60 years old and works on staff with a telephone company making 4 USD a day. Of their five children, three are married, while two are single and still live at the family home. The two children at home are garment factory workers, each earning 7 USD per day. She wants to use her loan to buy wood and repair their roof which has been leaking for some time.

loans.use: To repair the house's roof.

loans.name: Aksa

texts.en:
Aksa is 37 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 17 and 13 years old. Aksa sells clothes, and she started in 2004. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga and vitenge) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (khanga and vitenge, cultural favorites) for her business.

loans.name: Chanuka Support Group

texts.en:
The Chanuka support group was formed on 1st May 2005 with six founder members: Janet O. Achola, Samuel O. N., Selline J. O., Hyrene A. O., Lucas A. Odera, and Clarice O. Oluoch. The founding members came together to address issues that were affecting their lives. They came together with the aim of assisting each other and also contributing money to pay for the group members' transportation to attend clinical services at Chulaimbo Rural Health Centre.

With time, more members joined the group. The group currently has 45 registered members although only 40 are active. The members have also been trained by K-MET in Nutrition Support, Home Based Care services, and IGA (income generating activity) Management. The group is run by the Executive which is comprised of the Chairperson, Secretary, Assistant Secretary, Organizing Secretary, and the Treasurer. Those who are willing to join the group are required to meet certain conditions including paying a registration fee. Members are involved in well-established income generating activities such as poultry keeping, dairy farming, cereal businesses, vegetable sales, and community pharmacies. Since HIV/Aids is a concern in this area and nutrition supplements have played a role in HIV/Aids management, the group has applied for US $4000 from K-MET to enable them to buy Nutriflour in bulk and sell it to the community.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Buy Nutriflour in bulk for sale to the community.

loans.name: Bonkapri

texts.en:
This is Bonkapri K.. She is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to add on to to her current stock.

Bonkapri was born in Malal about 60 miles away from Makeni, some 40 years ago. She now lives with her husband and their 2 children here in Makeni. For over 6 years now, Bonkapri has been selling palm oil; from that business she is able to manage her affairs together with those of her children and relatives back home in Malal.

loans.use: Buy more gallons of palm oil to expand  her business

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Mrs. Yin U. lives in Preak Kranh village in the Kandal province. She grows vegetables in the field next to her village. She is a widow with five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. The other four children help their mother in the field. Mrs. Yin U. faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer to support her field or to purchase more vegetable seeds to cultivate. Mrs. Yin U. decided to ask for loan to solve these obstacles.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her field and purchase more vegetable seeds to cultivate.

texts.en:
Fatma, 26 years old and married with two children aged seven and five, has been a clothes and shoes seller since 2005. Everyday she works from 8:30 a.m. to 10 p.m. and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Fatma now requests a loan of $150 to buy more clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 46 años, se dedica al alquiler de habitaciones, así como también a la venta de juanes especiales (plato a base de arroz, típico de la región), es madre soltera y tiene 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son independientes. Gracias al alquiler de habitaciones y a la venta de juanes solventó los gastos escolares de sus hijos. En la actualidad, necesita mejorar las condiciones de sus habitaciones y remodelar las estructuras y ambientes, para brindar una mejor comodidad a sus clientes. Para ello necesita del préstamo que solicita.
texts.en:
Lucia is 46 years old. She works renting rooms, and also sells juanes especiales (a meal based on rice, traditional to the region). She is a single mother and she has 5 children, all of whom are living independently. Thanks to renting out the rooms and the sale of juanes, she has met the educational expenses of her children. At the moment, she needs to improve the conditions of her rooms and remodel the structures and surroundings, in order to provide better comfort to her clients. For this she needs the loan that she is asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel and improve the rooms Lucia rents

loans.name: Carol

texts.es:
La señora Carol pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000”, ubicado en la Av. Bellavista Nº 668, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como profesor de Educación Superior. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de especería (condimento). Tiene 1 año trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y especería (condimento), actividad que le brinda ganancias para poder pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo de S/1,200, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 2 cajas de leche, 1 paquete de aceite, ½ de arroz, 2 paquetes de harina, 7 kilos de cominos, 6 kilos de pimienta, salchicha, sillao, etc.

Gracias a Manuela Ramos su negocio ha mejorado. Se siente contenta porque tendrá la oportunidad de darle una mejor educación a sus 2 menores hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Carol belongs to the "Women of 2000" Communal Bank located at 668 Bellavista Ave. north, district of Callería, Colonel Portilla province, department of Ucayali. She is 28 years old and married. Her husband works as a professor of higher education. With the first loan that she received of Manuela Branches of 300 soles she decided to invest in the sale of spices (seasonings). She has been working with the Communal Bank for one year. Currently she is dedicated for sale of groceries and spices (seasonings), an activity that offers her profits to be able to pay her loan promptly. With this loan of 1,200 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 2 boxes of milk, 1 package of oil, ½ package of rice, 2 packages of flour, 7 kilograms of cumin, 6 kilograms of pepper, sausage, soy sauce, etc. Thanks to Manuela Branches her business has improved. she feels happy because she will have the opportunity to give a better education to her 2 small children.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packages of milk, oil, rice, flour, cumin, pepper, sausage, soy sauce, etc

loans.name: Hilarion

texts.es:
Hilarion J. vive en la calle Tocorpatty  de la zona de Sensata 79, zona peri urbana de la ciudad de el  Alto
 
Vive junto a su esposa, la cual posee una pequeña tienda de  abarrotes en su domicilio.Tiene tres hijos de 10, 8, 6 años, todos varones

Hilarion tiene un taller donde realiza reparaciones a movilidades de transporte pesado, también se dedica a la venta de neumáticos y repuestos para estos.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de mercadería para su posterior venta en el taller.
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgar el crédito
texts.en:
Hilarion J. lives on Tocorpatty street in the Sensata 79, a suburban zone of the city of El Alto. She lives with her wife, who has a small grocery store in their house. They have three sons, 10, 8 and 6 years old, respectively. Hilarion has a workshop where he performs repairs on heavy transport vehicle. He also works selling original and replacement tires. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise for future sale in his workshop. This is his second loan with Impro; the evaluation performed qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia tiene 30 años, vive con su  esposo y sus 2 hijos. Esta madre nunca deja de trabajar para lograr que su familia sea beneficiada con el fruto de su trabajo, se dedica a la crianza de animales que posteriormente vende en la feria ganadera, luego de varios meses de engorde, además, aprovecha la leche que producen sus vacas,  al día logra vender hasta 13 litros, y con las ganancias logra cubrir las necesidades de sus hijos. Es por ello que tiene mucho cuidado en la limpieza de su establo y en la alimentación de sus vacas y demás animales, ya que sería una perdida grande si una de sus vacas llega a enfermarse. Es su 4to préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las clientas más responsables de su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará alimento balanceado para sus animales, además invertirá en el negocio de armado de zapatos que hace un mes instaló en su casa.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. This mother never stops working to ensure that her family benefits from the fruit of her labor. She raises animals to then sell in the livestock market. After various months of fattening, she also takes advantage of the milk that her cows products. To date she has been able to sell 13 liters and with the profits cover her children’s necessities. She takes much care in cleaning her stable and in feeding her cows and other animals, as it would be a great loss if one of her cows became ill. This is her 4th loan with MFP, she is one of the most responsible members of her Communal Bank. With the money she will buy nutritionally balanced food for her animals, in addition she will invest in a shoe business that she opened one month ago in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy nutritionally balanced food for her animals

loans.name: Dam Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đàm Thị Bát, 58 tuổi ở Thanh Hóa. Gia đình chị có 3 con và đều đã lớn, có khả năng phụ giúp thêm cho gia đình. Nguồn thu chính của gia đình chị là từ nghề nông. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2007 và với việc sử dụng vốn có hiệu quả anh chị đã có điều kiện cho con ăn học ra trường, có việc làm, sửa sang được nhà cửa, đời sống gia đình được nâng cao. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000/ tháng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, sửa sang chuồng trại.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dam Thi B., 58 years old, lives in Thanh Hoa province.Her family has 3 grown-up children who can support the works in the family. The main source of income of her family is farming. She joined the Fund in 2007. With the profitable use of loans, she has money to support her children to study until graduation and employment, to renovate her house, and to improve the conditions of living.

In this loan cycle she wishes to borrow VND9,000,000 to buy poultry and to renovate the coop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy poultry and to renovate the coop

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil M. is a 27-year-old man. Jamil has been running his own small business for three years. He rents a store where he sells foodstuff, detergents, tooth-paste and other items.

Jamil is very friendly and polite which attracts clientele. He is requesting a loan of 1200 USD so that he can purchase more goods to sell and increase the range of products for sale. Jamil's dream is to provide his parents and future family with a better life and one day build his own store. Jamil promises to repay his loan during a 14-month time period and thanks everyone who decides to support him.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs for his little store

loans.name: Mujeres Del Alba Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Mujeres del alba” pertenece a la familia de  Pro-Mujer hace más de dos  años. La mencionada asociación  pertenece al centro focal Villa Adela, ubicada  en la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con dieciséis miembros.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación, por ejemplo algunos se dedican a la carpintería, otras  se dedican a la venta de artículos en cerámica, también venden abarrotes. La asociación Mujeres del alba  precisa  créditos para comprar mayor cantidad de productos, para poder ampliar sus ventas.
texts.en:
