The “Mujeres del Alba” Association has been with the Pro-Mujer family for more than two years. This association is in the center of the Villa Adela neighborhood, located in the city of El Alto. Currently they have 16 members. There are various businesses in the association: some engage in woodwork, others in selling ceramic articles, yet others sell groceries. This association needs loans to purchase larger quantities of product, in order to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of larger quantities of products

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
M. Sherali is 56 years old. He is married and has four children. Sherali's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. 

He is a taxi driver and travels through the streets of Tursunzade, Tajikistan in search of customers. He has owned his business for 30 years. Currently Sherali’s car needs some repairs and he wants to borrow 3000 Somoni for 10 months. The financing will go towards repairs of his vehicle purchasing winter tires. Sherali thanks Kiva and all lenders who make this help possible.     

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts to fix his car

loans.name: Sreyphun Ton Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyphun T. was selected to be a group leader by the group members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including hers. The entire group is living in a small village across Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mrs. Sreyphun T., 31, and her husband, Mr. Soksamphea Morm, 36, were married in 1991 and have three children; one son and two daughters. Two of their children attend school and another one is still young. Sreyphun has been a silk weaver for fourteen years; it’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman who then sells them in the Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been growing vegetables for sixteen years. Sreyphun is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

2-Mrs. Sreyphin T., 37, and her husband, Mr. Horn Chhit, 44, were married in 1993 and have no children yet. Sreyphin and her husband are silk weavers. They sell their finished products to the middleman who then sells them in the Phnom Penh market. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Nanda Kumari

texts.en:
Nanda Kumari M. lives in Thecho village. She lives in a single family residence with her husband and two children. She has one son, who is studying in grade 6, and one daughter, who is studying in grade 9.

Both Mrs. M. and Mr. Krishna Bahadur M. are engaged in making different types of brass religious statues. They make different types of statues according to the demands of their customers. They also receive orders from dealers. 

Mrs. Nanda Kumari M. has already taken a loan from Kiva and repaid it. With that previous loan, she was able to buy various types of raw materials for their work. Now she is requesting a loan of  NPR 30000 to buy additional raw materials necessary for their work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making brass religious statues

loans.name: Bùi Thị

texts.en:
Quá Bùi Thị owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale.She is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Quang Xuong. She is married and has two adult children. Quá has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month.

In 2006, Quá joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Quá has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. Quá is now requesting a loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase new livestock to raise and sell. This will be her fifth loan from TYM Fund. Quá plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. No. 1706060151.

loans.use: To purchase new livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn C. sells chicken chicharon and other fried chicken parts in the MOGCHS school canteen. Her customers are students of the school. Fried chicken parts are very tasty and that is why her products are in great demand. Marilyn is 31 years old, married and has one school-age child. She is from the village of Gusa, Cagayan de Oro City. Marilyn has been in this business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a food business

location.town: Gusa, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora es comerciante se dedica a la compra y venta de queso, repartiendo en domicilios de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz.
Vive en la zona de irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de queso).
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la segunda vez que requiere el apoyo de kiva.
Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Teodora operates a business buying and selling cheese, delivering her products to houses throughout the southern neighborhoods of La Paz. She lives in the Irpavi II area of La Paz in a house that she owns. The loan will be used for working capital (cheese purchases). This is her third Impro loan and the second one that has required support from Kiva. The earnings from working have given her the opportunity to get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stocks for retail cheese business.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Bancomunal  San Luí, es conviviente tiene 44 años y tiene un hijo de 17 años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Olga estudio corte y confección y trabajo en un taller de costura por diez años, hasta que su hermano le regalo una remalladota y ella empezó a confeccionar buzos, gorras de natación, ella trabaja por contratos en colegios y cose buzos y cortinas.
Desde que Olga esta en Finca aprendió la importancia del ahorro y de tener dinero para emergencia que se puedan presentar en el negocio.    
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles, para compra tela de polar,  tela para  cortinas
El sueño de Olga es tener un taller de confecciones y comprase una maquina recta.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the San Luí Communal Bank. She is 44 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a 17 year old son who is studying at a state school.

Olga studied tailoring and has been working in a sewing workshop for ten years. Her brother gave her an industrial sewing machine as a gift and she began making track suits and swim caps. She has contracts with a few colleges to make caps and curtains.

Since joining FINCA, Olga has learned the importance of saving and having enough money in case an emergency arises in her business. She is requesting a loan of 1800 soles, which will be used to buy fleece and fabric for curtains. Olga dreams of having her own clothing store and buying a straight-line stitching machine.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fleece & fabric

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 66 years old. She is widowed and the mother of six children. All her children are grownups and independent but she lives with four of her grandchildren. She works hard to provide food and school fees for the grandchildren. She is mostly assisted by her children for finances and other basic things.

Grace is a trader and trades in flour, sugar, margarine, bags of rice, etc., in the market center where she lives. She takes delivery of stock from wholesalers and retails them at her rented store. She has been in business for the last six years now. She requests the loan to add to her capital so that she can buy more stock to upgrade her business.

loans.use: To buy more materials to sell like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, bags of rice, etc.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Mrs. Kamala Bashnet lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Nepal. Kamala has two sons; both are studying in Higher Secondary School. Her husband is a taxi driver and drives his taxi in Kathmandu valley. 
Kamala already has one cow and she sells cow's milk door-to-door daily, morning and evening. The demand for cow's milk is increasing in that area because grass-fed cow's milk is good for health. 



Now Kamala is requesting the second loan of Rs 25000.00 to purchase a young cow because of the increased demand for cow’s milk in her area. She has grassland of her own, so she does not has to buy food for her cows.

loans.use: to buy young cow

loans.name: Damaris Nohemi

texts.es: Damaris Nohemi espera ser beneficiada por  segunda vez con  el fondo Kiva, para invertirlo en construcción de una habitación, trabaja como tecnica del Ministerio de Educaciòn, le urge construir una habiatcion y así mejorar las condiciones de vida del nucleo familiar ya que AFODENIC ofrece un interés bajo  y  politicas de creditos accesibles para las personas de escasos recursos econòmicos, tiene capacidad y voluntad de pago, es una joven trabajadora, honesta y muy apreciada en su comunidad, su esposo trabaja como taxista y comparten los gastos familiares y  los compromisos, su mayor sueño es tener una vivienda digna y bonita, seguir estudiando para asi obtener mejores conocimientos y ser cada dia una persona mejor.
texts.en:
Damaris Nohemi hopes to receive her second loan from Kiva in order to build a room. She works as a technician in the Ministry of Education. The room is urgently needed to improve the living conditions of her nuclear family. AFODENIC offers low interest, and the loan policies make loans accessible for people with scant economic resources. She has the ability and desire to pay. She is a hard-working, honest, and very appreciated young woman in her community. Her husband works as a taxi driver. They share the family expenses and their commitments. Her biggest dreams are to have a decent, attractive house; to keep studying to gain more knowledge; and to be a better person each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth M. is 53 years-old, married, and lives at Poblacion, Siayan, in Zamboanga del Norte. She has four children. She spends her life with her husband. She has been a member of PAGLAUM since August 2007, and is now applying for a loan of 25,000 pesos to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari (convenience) store, including rice, laundry items, seasoning, goods, toiletries and other household items.

Elizabeth successfully manages her business and is able to cover her daily consumption needs as well as save for the future.

loans.use: additonal stock for general store

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal U. is 30 years old; single, with one child who is six years old. Chantal lives in Gasabo district, in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, where she has owned a popular and attractive hair salon since 2007.

In her salon, Chantal employs three people from her community. Chantal is requesting a loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through buying salon equipment and materials.

loans.use: More equipment

loans.name: Lacen Kome Tek Anema Harriet Group

texts.en: A. Harriet is a business lady, 24 years old and married with three children. Two of the children are schooling. She has been selling used clothes for over two months. She is requesting a loan to increase her capital so that she can really stock up on more clothes for her business. She is a promising business lady whose dream is to see her business prosper.

loans.use: To stock more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 46 years old, married, and is the mother of four children. Her husband is retired and his pension is $250.

She has experience of twenty years in this business and nine years ago she established her own shop. She has received three loans including this one, and has made all the repayments in a timely manner. As a result of these loans she raised her income and became capable of getting more customers.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Pony

texts.en:
Pony R. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy crates of sodas and beer to sell.  Pony is 40 years old and is married to a policeman. She has eight children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy crates of sodas and beer to sell.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and their children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Maame is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice porridge. She hawks to sell in the mornings in her community. Maame has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice.

loans.name: 025 -Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hạnh N. Thị (1) is a 41 year-old woman who lives in the town of Thanh Hoá. Hạnh is the leader of a 6-member group loan sponsored by the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 025-Quảng Hưng (18.7.025).

Hạnh is married. To making a living, she raises and sells chickens. Hạnh has been engaged in this business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2000000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hạnh has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women that she used to purchase chicks to raise and sell.

She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND to purchase more chicks. This will be Hanh's 4th loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hạnh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

The other borrowers in this group have livestock businesses and are requesting loans of 6000000 VND loan each to support their businesses. Hà Thị Xuân (7) is a 57 year-old woman. N. Thị Bình (4) is a 34 year-old woman. N. Thị Tiến (3) is a 48 year-old woman. P. Thị Dung (2) is a 55 year-old woman. N. Thị Bích (6) is a 27 year-old woman.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Hạnh N. Thị (1) là 41 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở tH.nh phố Thanh Hoá. Hạnh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các tH.nh viên. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 025-Quảng Hưng (18.7.025). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán. Hạnh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 20 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Hạnh kiếm được khoảng 2000000 VND. Vào 2009, Hạnh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Hạnh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Hà Thị Xuân (7) là 57 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 2. N. Thị Bình (4) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 3. N. Thị Tiến (3) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. P. Thị Dung (2) là 55 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. N. Thị Bích (6) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Allyn

texts.en:
Allyn L. is from the village of Toril. She is 38 years old. Allyn is married and has two school age children. 

To make a living, Allyn owns a flower shop business in which she sells flowers to the local community.  She also owns a "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) business & sari-sari (convenience store) business.  Allyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Allyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Allyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Allyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Bismarck Salvador

texts.es:
El Señor Bismarck C. C., Labora como Jardinero en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez.
 El tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y estos  se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, para el techo de su casa ya que el que  tiene esta perforado y en invierno el agua se pasa.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Bismarck C. C. works as a gardener in the Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez. He takes care of two school age children, is married, and has had loans with CEPRODEL for three years. During this period, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, he has invested three loans in the improvement of the dwelling in which he lives. He is an excellent client.

The loan applied for is to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as zinc for the roof of his house. The roof has leaks, and in winter water gets in. His goal is to offer better security and better living conditions to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements and enlargements to a dwelling.

loans.name: Bella's Group

texts.en:
Bella D. is from the village of Villa Nuesa. She is 35 years old. Bella is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Bella D.'s group.

Bella is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Bella owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Bella has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Bella joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Bella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Bella is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Bella from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: By God's Grace Group

texts.en:
Garmai J. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called By God’s Grace. She is 29 years old, single, and has two children aged one and six years old. Her six-year-old is in elementary school, and Garmai herself is a high school graduate.

For 6 years, Garmai has been selling dry goods (an assortment of foodstuffs and household products) at the Red Light Market.  Red Light is Liberia's largest market, and is located in Paynesville on the outskirts of the capital Monrovia. Garmai says she sells good products in a friendly manner, which keeps her customers returning.

Garmai plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 50,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more goods.  Her goal is to grow her business to a bigger one and improve her family's living conditions.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Garmai is the one holding the sign. Garrison F. is inset at lower right. 

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more goods for a general store (dry goods shop).

loans.name: Ing

texts.en: Ing N. is married and resides with her four children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She is engaged in the agriculture sector as a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver in the city, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Their standard of living has improved since Ing N.’s husband has had this business. She is requesting a loan of USD 400 to purchase a compartment attached to her husband's motorbike to expand his business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a compartment attached to the motorbike

loans.name: Gloria Ernestina

texts.es: Gloria Ernestina es una mujer muy responsable y lo ha demostrado con los créditos que ha tenido con Fundación. Actualmente ella se dedica a una pulpería,   por lo que tiene más de 6 años de realizar esta labor, que le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Ella no tenía el capital suficiente  para comprar la variedad de productos que le solicitaban, fue con los financiamientos que logro progresar con su negocio. Gloria está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de café, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, detergente, papel higiénico entre otros productos. Su deseo es que sus hijos sean personas de bien y logren ser excelente profesionales.
texts.en:
Gloria Ernestina is a very responsible woman and has demonstrated this with the credits she has had with the Foundation. Currently she is dedicated to her grocery store, which has taken her 6 years to achieve. It has costed her significant effort and sacrifice. She did not have sufficient capital to buy the variety of products that her clients requested. It was through financing that she was able to progress with her business. Gloria is requesting this financing for the purchase of coffee, rice, beans, sugar, oil, detergent, toilet paper, and other products. Her wish is that her children be good people in life and that they excel in their professions.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
A. Muyassar is 49 years old. She is married and has two children. Muyassar, together with her husband, has a business making dairy products and selling them to groceries, market stands, and local neighbors in their community. Muyassar is telling us that day by day, her children are growing up and their expenses are rising too. She always dreamed her children would be well educated and she is doing the best she can to realize her dream. So she is very motivated to succeed in her daily and weekly sales goals. Now Muyassar feels that with additional capital she can increase her sales and profits. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $2,700 USD. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dreams become reality.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make dairy products

loans.name: Shirley's Group

texts.en:
Shirley A. is from the village of Danipa. She is 35 years old. Shirley is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Shirley A. Group.

Shirley is single. To make a living, Shirley owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Shirley has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Shirley joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shirley has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Shirley is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Shirley from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma C. is from the village of Agoho, Mambajao, Camiguin Provice. She is 47 years old. Thelma is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Thelma makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Thelma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Thelma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used as additional working capital. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make more snack products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Thelma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Oeun's Group

texts.en: This group loan consists of six people who live in Peam Reang Leu village in Kandal province. All members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Oeun L., 36, is the group leader selected by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Phorlla Chan, are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. Their problem is that their field is infertile. So to improve production, Mrs. Oeun L. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to rent a plowing machine to plow her field. She is the mother of three children: one is a laborer, one attends the local public school, and the youngest one is five years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to rent a plowing machine

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La ciudad de Rayanniyoc se encuentra media hora de la ciudad del Cusco y a una hora de la ciudad del Urubamba. Los pobladores de la ciudad de Rayanniyoc se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería. 
 
La señora Luisa, tiene 51 años y tiene  8 hijos de las cuales 3 son independientes y 5 depende de ella todavía. 

Su actividad económica principal de Luisa es vender cereales como por ejemplo tarwi, trigo y muchos productos más. Los días miércoles, viernes y domingos viaja a la ciudad de Urubamba a donde lleva sus productos y se instala en su puesto de venta en el mercado de Urubamba y los días sábados lleva sus productos  a la ciudad del Cusco y se instala en el mercado Molino II. Su actividad económica complementaria es confeccionara chompas, chulos, guantes y chalinas de lana de alpaca. 
 
Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios años que participita en el banco comunal y ella se recuerda que el primer crédito que le dieron fue de 100 dólares. Actualmente, requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos como por ejemplo tarwi, trigo, cebada, etc.
texts.en:
The city of Rayanniyoc is located half an hour from the city of Cusco, and one hour from the city of Urubamba. The residents of the city of Rayanniyoc work in agriculture and raise livestock. Luisa is 51 years old and she has 8 children, 3 of whom are economically independent and 5 still depend on her. Luisa’s business is selling cereals, such as Andean lupine beans, wheat, and many other products. On Wednesdays, Fridays, and Sundays she travels to the city of Urubamba. She takes her products with her and situates herself in her stall in the Urubamba market. On Saturdays she takes her products to the city of Cusco and sells in the Molino II market. Her complementary business activity is knitting sweaters, woolen caps, gloves, and alpaca shawls. Luisa belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Villa Rayanniyoc” communal bank. She has been participating in the communal bank for several years and she remembers that the first they gave her was for $100.00. Now she needs a loan to buy more products such as, for example, Andean lupine beans, wheat, barley, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cereals, such as wheat, Andean lupine beans, etc.

loans.name: Karn

texts.en:
Karn S., 35, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. 

S. is a housewife, while her husband is a motor-taxi driver and a policeman, earning an income of $7 per day. S. is requesting a loan of $500 to repair her house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to run a grocery shop at home.  

This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the house

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Oyunbileg N. is 26 years old and lives with her husband and mother in Bayanhongor province, central Mongolia. They live in their own ger, a traditional nomadic housing tent.

Oyunbileg operates a noodle-making shop with the help of her husband. She and her husband began the business in 2007 after purchasing noodle-producing equipment with 1,500,000 MNT. Since then, they have been operating their business sustainably and actively.

The two would like to keep growing their business and be able to increase production types so that this business will be popular among their customers. Oyunbileg is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase equipment and more flour used in the production of noodles.

Oyunbileg hopes to create her own noodle factory in her town in the future.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and more flour

loans.name: Marcia Susana

texts.es:
La Señorita. Marcia Susana C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres en Expansión, vive por un sector muy conocido como es Vizorrey en la ciudad de Cuenca, este sector es parte de la belleza cuencana, al igual que sus ríos, su gente, y su gastronomía.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres colaborando en lo que puede en el hogar. Trabaja en el comedor que es de propiedad de su madre en el cual labora hace 18 años, su horario es de 7 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m., también se dedica a la venta de los productos de medicina natural Omnilife, sus ventas las realiza de 5 p.m. hasta las 8 p.m.
 
Es el cuarto crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, fue invitada por una amiga que es socia, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de Omnilife, su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
La Señorita Marcia Susana C. is a member of the communal bank Mujeres en Expansión (Successful Women). She lives in a well-known area: Vizorrey in the city of Cuenca. This area, as well as its rivers, people, and food, is part of the beauty of Cuenca. Our member is 28 years old, single, and lives in her parent's house. She assists with various jobs in the home. She has worked in her mother's dining room since she was 18. She begins work at 7 a.m. and ends at 4 p.m. She also sells Omnilife natural medicines from 5 in the evening until 8 p.m. This is her fourth loan with the communal bank. A friend invited her to become a member. This new loan will be invested in Omnilife products. Her goal is to promote the growth of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Omnilife products.

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Mrs. Toem S., who was born in 1974, lives in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.2-hectare (3-acre) plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Ratha Seang, is a grass seller in the local village and he is also a fisherman. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

Mrs. Toem S.’s problem is that it is time to grow rice but she does not have enough rice seed. So, to improve matters, she is asking for a loan to buy rice seed.

Mrs. Toem S. is the mother of five children, one of whom is a laborer, while the others are attending school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed for her farm

loans.name: Ferdinard Ireri

texts.en:
Ferdinard is a 58-year-old man married to Lucy Mutitu. They have six children, two of whom are dependent on him. He runs a greengrocer shop. He has been in the business for a period of about sixth months now. He has been making a profit of approximately $63 a month.

He intends to use the loan to add more stock of fruits and vegetables. He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friends.  He hopes to have all his children through with their studies and to be stable in the future. He also wants to use the profit to renovate his house and open a permanent store for his goods.

loans.use: Buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Aura Magaly

texts.es:
La Sra. Aura Magaly Q. G.  es comerciante activa del mercado central, tiene 39 años, es madre soltera de dos hijas, se dedica a la venta de ropa con experiencia de 23 años en el negocio.

Este crédito lo utilizo para Compra de pañales, calcetines, toallas, blúmer, etc., se siente muy contenta con los créditos que se ceprodel le ha otorgado ya que ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo y así ha podido mejorar su nivel de vida tanto el de ella como el de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Sra. Aura Magaly Q. G. is an active merchant at the central market. She is 39 years old and a single mother of two daughters. Aura sells clothing and has 23 years of experience in this business.

This loan will be used to buy diapers, socks, towels, undergarments, and other products. She is very pleased with the loans CEPRODEL has provided because they have allowed her to increase her operating capital and improve the quality of life for herself and her daughters.

loans.use: Purchase diapers, socks, towels, undergarments, and other products

loans.name: Crislyn

texts.en:
Crislyn S. is from the city of Libag Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 19 years old. Crislyn is married and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Crislyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Crislyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP when she sells her raised pigs.

In 2009, Crislyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crislyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Crislyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Crislyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
Nyamjav M. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family have been living in their own apartment for past 9 years. His oldest daughter is a university student while his two sons, ages 11 and 12, attend a local secondary school. 

Nyamjav currently operates a wooden products making business in his town. He designs and produces many different styles and sizes of furniture that he sells throughout his community. He started his business in 1989 with capital of 50,000 MNT and has found success in his production and trade. Today, his business is well established in the local area, and his working capital exceeds 4,200,000 MNT. For the future, Nyamjav says, "My dreams are to expand my business and to provide a good education for my children." 

He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood and timber to make wooden products.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and timber

loans.name: Mutunga

texts.en:
Mutunga K. is a 34-year-old businessman who sells charcoal at the Nairobi Tena estate. Tena is a well-populated medium class estate with most people using charcoal for cooking, so Mutunga’s customers are many. He is married to Catherine Nzisa and together they have three children, two sons aged 10 and 4 years who go to school and one daughter aged 3 years. He has been running the charcoal business for 10 years and his monthly profit is Kshs 4,000.

Mutunga was introduced to Kadet Ltd by other Kadet customers; previously he received a loan from another micro finance institution called Jamii Bora before joining Kadet Ltd. This will be his second loan from Kadet with which he will buy more sacks of charcoal to increase his stock. If the loan boosts the business, Mutunga will open another charcoal outlet in the neighborhood.

With promising future prospects, Mutunga dreams of becoming a big charcoal distributor who will buy a car for transporting his charcoal and be able to educate his children to high levels. He describes himself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To increase his stock of charcoal

loans.name: Herlita

texts.en:
Herlita B., 29, is from the town of Sta. Josefa.  She is married and has two children aged 9 and 11.  To make a living, Herlita plants, harvests and sells rice. Herlita keeps the farm free of weeds and pests and hopes to increase her harvest.

Herlita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Herlita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.  Herlita is requesting a new loan of 16000 PHP to purchase farm inputs like rice and fertilizers. This loan will be her ninth from CEVI.   She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs like rice and fertilizers

loans.name: Carmen Marilu

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal La Unión Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Carmen, ella es madre  soltera de una niña de siete años que estudia en escuela. Vive en casa de sus padres.

Para poder sacar a  su hija adelante y no depender de nadie ella empezó un negocio de venta de sabanas, cortinas y de productos para el hogar como: planchas, licuadoras, camas, etc. productos de La Gran Cadena. Trabaja tres días a la semana en las entregas y los cobros ya que deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. Dice que lleva 5 años en esto y que le ha ido bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sabanas, cortinas y otros productos para el hogar. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos que son fáciles de conseguir. Sus sueños son tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
The members of the “La Unión Hace La Fureza” (Strength Through Unity) Communal Bank meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton.  This place is known for the delicious sweets that its inhabitants make.  The sweets are known throughout the whole country.

This is where we find Carmen.  She is the single mother of a seven year old daughter who goes to school.  She lives in her parents’ house.  In order to be able to get her daughter ahead and not be dependent upon anyone, she started a business selling sheets and curtains.  She also sells household items like irons, blenders, and bedroom accessories, etc. She sells products from a large chain store.  She works three days a week on deliveries and collections.  She gives credit, and she collects every week.  She has been doing this for five years, and it has gone well for her.

She will use this loan to buy sheets, curtains, and other household items.  This is her second cycle with the communal bank.  She likes it because of the loans and the ease of getting a loan.

Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy sheets, curtains, irons, and blenders, etc.

loans.name: Felix Alfredo

texts.es:
Felix Alfredo S. D. tiene 35 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Felix Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y García.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa un terreno y poder sembrar.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Felix Alfredo S. D. is 35 and lives with his common law wife and their 3 children in Moncache canton, in Los Ríos province.

The members of the V.R.C. 27 de Octubre communal bank are located in the Santa Sofía district.  All have been farmers for a long time and work with short cycle crops,  especially corn, rice and beans

Felix Alfredo farms corn and rice.  He buys the seeds in Comercial Briones  (store) and sells his products in Comercial Vaca y García (store).
He is requesting the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to plant corn and rice and beans.   The financing  will help him purchase what he needs.  He has to deal with problems such as infestations, plant diseases and the changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a house, and a field where he can plant.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Pineapple 2 Group

texts.en:
Veolita P. operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in her community. She is 50 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Pob. Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ. Veolita has been in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2010, Veolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Veolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

Veolita is the leader of a two member group accessing a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Pineapple 2".

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for a restaurant

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is a 63-year old married woman who supports her family by selling Tupper Ware and cosmetics. She lives in Bago City, Negros Occidental.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 9,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP).  

Cherry is borrowing 8,000 PHP to purchase more items to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 8,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Cherry aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Confort Oladogni

texts.fr: Mademoiselle confort a  45 ans  et mère d’un enfant.  Elle fait la vente de produits cosmétiques  pour  répondre  aux besoins de son enfant.   Elle a commencé son activité  en 2003 et achète les produits au grand  marché de Lomé.  Ensuite elle les revend au marché local de hedzranawoé.   Elle sollicite un crédit pour  acheter de nouveaux lots de produits.
texts.en: Ms. Confort is 45 years old and has one child. She sells cosmetic products in order to support her child. She launched this business in 2003. She stocks up at the big market of Lomé. She then resells her goods at the local market of Hedzranawoé. She is seeking a credit to buy a new supply of goods.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetic products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra: Doris;  La socia tiene 40 años de edad; La socia es conviviente; la socia tiene 3 hijos de 19,17,3 años de edad;  La socia  tiene un hospedaje en su propia casa, ella acomodo sus habitaciones y los baños para recibir turistas; La socia está en continuos cambios , ampliaciones, acabados, decorados y mucho más en lo referente a su vivienda, ella siempre que tiene un dinero extra lo invierte en mejorar sus ambientes, ella en esta oportunidad está deseando el crédito para ampliar y mejorar sus ambientes dentro del hospedaje. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la  ampliación de ambientes dentro del hospedaje.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Doris is a member of the "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo" (The Friendship of Ollantaytambo) community bank which is located in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Doris is 40 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children aged 19, 17 and 3.  She provides accommodations in her own home where she has adapted rooms and bathrooms to receive tourists. She is constantly making changes, extensions, finishing off building work, decorating and doing other work related to her property.  Every time she has a bit of extra money she invests it in improving the rooms within her guest house. 

Doris is requesting this loan to invest in extending the rooms within her guest house.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to invest in extending rooms within her guest house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 39-year-old single mother of six children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has been dealing in clothes for 20 years. She started with capital of 500,000 shillings and now has 3,000,000 shillings. She has a challenge of limited funds to meet the demands of her customers and her desire is to educate her children and set up a boutique.

She will use the loan to buy clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy  clothes to resell

loans.name: Sob

texts.en:
Sob M., age 54, is a homemaker with many daily household duties. She is responsible for such tasks as cooking meals, caring for her children, washing clothes, controlling cash flow, and managing other properties in and around her house. She has a life partner in her husband who sellsgoods at market to cover the daily expenses of the family. They have two unmarried children. 

Their daughter works in the garment industry, earning a monthly salary of around $70 USD per month. She has been paying for taxis to get to work because she doesn't own a vehicle. To solve this problem, Sob Makle is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle, which will allow her daughter to commute to her work location.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for daughter to commute to her work location

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martín forma parte del banco comunal “Aurora Boreal” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
El se dedica al servicio de peluquería canina, desde hace 3 años. Comenzó en éste rubro, atendiendo a domicilio, posteriormente estableció su negocio en su casa y en la actualidad arrienda un local en el sector donde vive. Además agregó a su negocio la venta de artículos para mascotas, ya sea cepillos, arnés, juguetes, entre otros. La temporada de más alta demanda de sus servicios es entre los meses de septiembre y abril, por lo que a la fecha su negocio ha ido en progreso. 
Con éste préstamo arreglará su vehículo particular, ya que lo utiliza para el traslado de mascotas. Además comprará artículos varios para mascotas. 
Sus metas son posicionarse en el sector y contar con más clientela. Ya que hace 1 año aproximadamente se instaló en éste sector. 
Martín vive junto a su esposa e hijo de 3 años de edad. Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio surgen a partir de sus anhelos de tener una vida socioeconómica más confortable. 
Martín está muy contento y agradecido del apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, debido a la facilidad de optar a los créditos y confianza entregada en él y su negocio. El participa activamente de las reuniones, ya que además es delegado del banco comunal y su grupo. Martín se siente a gusto, ya que su grupo es muy unido y solidario. Respecto a los cursos impartidos en las reuniones ha podido integrar estos aprendizajes en su propio negocio, sobre todo en el registro de sus gastos e ingresos, por lo que lleva su negocio de manera organizada. 
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Martín is a member of the “Aurora Boreal” communal bank belonging to the city of Viña del Mar.

He has been a Dog Groomer for the last three years.  He started out in this line of work providing service at customers’ homes.  Later on he opened his business in his house and currently rents a locale in his neighborhood.  In addition, he added on to his business the sale of pet supplies: brushes, harnesses and toys, among others.  The months between September and April are the ones with the highest demand for his services which means his business has been progressing well.  He will use this loan to repair his private vehicle because he uses it to transport the pets.  He will also buy assorted pet supplies.  His goals are to position himself in the sector and to have more customers.  He started in this business about a year ago.

Martín lives with his wife and three year old son.  His motivation to stay in business rises from his wish to have a more comfortable socioeconomic life.

Martín is very happy with and grateful for the support provided by Fondo Esperanza reflected in the ease of loan acquisition and the trust placed in him and his business.  He participates actively in the meetings for he is a delegate from his communal bank and his group.  Martín is comfortable because his group is very united and mutually supportive.  With respect to the training courses offered, he’s been able to apply what he’s learned to his own business, especially keeping track of income and expenses, which makes it possible for him to keep his business well organized.

Viña del Mar is a city and commune along Chile’s central coast.  It is known as the Garden City due to the gardens and patios many of the old houses in the city have.  It is also considered to be Chile’s tourism capital.

loans.use: to service his vehicle and to buy pet supplies.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Revendeuse de profession, Abla a 38 ans et a 03 enfants avec son mari tapissier. Elle s’est lancée dans la vente de pagnes et d’assiettes en aluminium depuis 1999,tout en s’approvisionnant à Lomé  elle est distributrice, de ses articles dans les marchés locaux, activité qu’elle mène à bien afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille tout en épaulant son mari, elle aimerait agrandir son étalage d’où ce premier prêt auprès de notre institution.
texts.en: Retailer by profession, Abla is 38 and has 3 children with her husband, who works as a upholsterer. She started selling traditional cloth and tin plates in 1999. She gets those items in Lomé, which she supplies to local markets. She has been working in order to support her family and help her husband. She would like to expand her stall, which is why she is applying for this first loan from our institution.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth and plates

loans.name: Nomanyo Abla Sitsofe

texts.fr: Résidant à Akodesséwa (un quartier  du pays), Mme Abla est  célibataire. Elle se donne à l’activité de vente de sous-vêtement  de femmes et enfants depuis 2004 de façon ambulante  après avoir acheté au Grand Marché de Lomé. Ce premier prêt  lui servira à acheter  les articles afin de vendre pour louer un local afin de mieux se positionner pour satisfaire ses nombreuses clientes  et préparer mieux sa future vie maritale.
texts.en: A resident of Akodesséwa (an area of the country), Mrs. Abla is single.  She has dedicated herself to the business of selling women's and children's undergarments as a travelling salesperson since 2004, after having bought her products at the Big Market of Lomé.  This first loan will serve to purchase products in order to sell them, so that she can rent a place to better position herself to meet the needs of her numerous customers and prepare for her future marital life.

loans.use: to purchase women's and children's undergarments.

loans.name: Yorleidis

texts.es:
Yorleidis se considera una joven luchadora, pues desde hace pocos meses se dedicó a vender helados, en casa de su tia donde vive actualmente ubicada en el municipio de Medellín departamento de Antioquia ya que su madre vive en bello , un municipio de este mismo departamento pero que está alejado del área metropolitana. Su negocio nació de la necesidad de contribuir con el pago de los gastos del hogar y de su sostenimiento. 

A sus 21 años de edad, Yorleidis se siente orgullosa de su labor y de su contribución a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Sin embargo hoy en día está esperando por una beca que el municipio de Medellín le otorga a la población para sus estudios, pues como ella misma lo afirma la educación es la mejor solución para el desarrollo humano y personal.

En el futuro Yorleidis espera tener un negocio de helados mas grande, que sea reconocida en el sector y que le permita generar mayores ingresos y para ir construyendo ese sueño necesita de un préstamo que le permitirá comprar mayor variedad de helados para incrementar sus ventas y así mismo sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Yorleidis considers herself to be a young fighter since a few months ago she began selling ice cream in her aunts home where she now resides located in the Medellín municipality, department of Antioquia since her mother lives in Bello, a municipality of the same department but is very far from the metropolitan area. Yorleidis’ business started out of necessity to help meet the household expenses and for her sustenance.

At her 21 years of age, Yorleidis feels proud of her work and her contribution to improve the quality of life of her family. Despite that, to this day she is waiting for a scholarship that the municipality of Medellín gives to the population for their education, as she asserts, an education is the best solution for human and personal development.

In the future, Yorleidis hopes to have a bigger ice cream business, that she is recognized in the area and that will allow her to have more income and to begin building that dream she needs a loan that will allow her to buy a greater variety of ice cream to increase her sales as her earnings.

loans.use: buy a greater variety of ice cream.

loans.name: Venera's Group

texts.en:
Venera is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married to an electrician, whose monthly salary is 10000 soms. Together with her husband she brings up a daughter and two sons. The daughter and the first son study at school and the second son is preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn additional money to meet the family's needs, Venera breeds livestock. She started this activity sixteen years ago when she got livestock inherited from her parents. She applied for the loan because she needs money to increase the number of livestock. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase two livestock animals for breeding. In the future, Venera wishes to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Rode Maria

texts.es: La señora Rode Maria tiene 32 años, es una mujer casada y tiene 1 hijo el cual aun es menor de edad. Hace más 4 años de dedicarse a una farmacia, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella dio inicio a este negocio ante la necesidad que sufría de ingresos para la manutención de su familia en general. Por lo que con todo el esfuerzo logro obtener capital propio, y en parte de su familia que la apoyaron para establecer este negocio. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de vitaminas, pastillas, jarabes, inyecciones, algodón entre otros.
texts.en: Rode Maria is 32 years old, married, and has one dependent child.  She has been running a pharmacy in her home for more than four years.  She started this business as she needed income to support her family.  With a lot of effort, she managed to obtain her own capital and also received the support of her family in setting up her business.  This loan will be invested in buying vitamins, pills, syrups, injections, cotton wool, etc.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, pills, syrups, injections, cotton wool and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hair blow drier and hair products.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang is a grocery seller. Her husband is a construction worker. Their income is $7 per day. She has two children who are 17 and 16 years old. Both of them are studying. Every month she has to spend $45 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $800 to buy grocery goods to sell. Before her family was doing farming, but they changed to business because they can make more income than doing farming. For her children, she will help them study at the university when they finish high school.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Emprendedores De Vitarte Group

texts.es: El grupo Emprendedores de Vitarte, está conformado por la unión de varias mujeres emprendoras. Todas las integrantes del grupo desarrollan distintas actividades de forma conjunta y solidaria, dentro de un ambiente de compañerismo, respeto y unión. La señora Pilar es una de ellas, tiene 42 años, es casada y con 6 hijos, cinco son menores de edad y dependen de ella y de su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de Yogurt hace diez años, con esta venta genera los ingresos que pueden pagar los gastos que se da día a día en su hogar, como la compra de la comida, y de los gastos de colegio que paga mensualmente. Con el reciente préstamo ella quiere formalizar y registrar su pequeño negocio y estar en regla con sus documentos y más adelante formarla como una empresa.
texts.en: The communal bank Emprendedores de Vitarte is comprised of various women entrepreneurs.  All of the members of the group are involved in different businesses but form a united, supportive group within an atmosphere of friendship, respect and union.  Mrs. Pilar is one of the members.  She is 42, married and has six children, five of whom are minors and live with her and her husband.  She has been selling yoghurt for ten years which has allowed her to cover the daily household expenses, such as groceries and monthly school expenses.  With this loan she wants to formalize and register her small business so she will have the documents to establish a company in the future.

loans.use: To formalize her business.

loans.name: Mukhamed

texts.ru:
Мухамед трудолюбивый, честный и добрый человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Более 15 лет он занимается  купля продажей мужских брюк, костюм и сорочек. Когда первый раз он получил кредит от Имон Интернэшнл в размере 600$ США, дал ему хороший прибыль, а потом постепенно он увеличил размер кредита. В прошлом году когда рынок сгорел Имон Интернэшнл не требовал у него проценты а наоборот поддерживал его, ему дали льготный срок для того чтобы он мог без всяких трудностей погасит займ . Теперь он хочет еще получит займ- это будет помогать ему купить много товаров по низкой цене и продать по рознице и он будет получить хорошую прибыль. Он благодарен Имон Интернэшнлу и Киве за поддержку и милосердие.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Mukhamed is a hard-working, honest and kind person.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  He has been involved in buying and selling of men's trousers, suits and shirts.  When he first obtain a loan in the sum of $600 from Imon International, he made a good profit, and then he gradually began increasing his loan amounts.  Last year, when the market burned down, Imon International did not demand interest, but instead supported him by extending his repayment term, so that he could repay his loan without any difficulties.  Now, Mukhamed wants to obtain another loan, which would help him to buy a lot of goods at low prices, then sell them at retail prices and make a good profit.  He is grateful to Imon International and Kiva for the support and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Keep On Trying Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Fatmata was born in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone, about 35 years ago. She is married to a motor mechanic and the couple have three children who are attending secondary and primary schools. Fatmata sells palm-oil, rice, groundnuts (peanuts), etc. She has been a businesswoman for nearly 20 years now. 

With the help of this loan, Fatmata and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Fatmata will use her share of the loan (800,000 Leone) to buy palm-oil, rice, groundnuts, etc. in large quantities for resale.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, rice, groundnuts, etc. in bulk for resale

loans.name: Jermelito

texts.en:
Jermelito is a farmer from Surallah, South Cotabato. He is 48 years old and married. His 7 children are between the ages of 5 and 20 years.

Jermelito has been growing and selling rice for 15 years. He earns about 5000 PHP per month from farming. Jermelito also works as a part-time driver. He works hard to provide the needs of his family and send his children to school.

Jermelito is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes to have a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Dely

texts.en:
Dely is 51 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. Dely runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy more stock to sell in her general store.
Dely has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.
Dely aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en:
