To make living, Jerson has a rice farming business. He started this business when he was 20 years old. He is lucky to be married to a teacher. Now, Jerson is 29 years of age and already has two children. 

Jerson's primary source of income which enables him to provide for his family's daily food and other household expenses is farming. He has been in this business for nine years. With the high cost of farm inputs now, Jerson is asking for a loan of 27,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer, seed, and herbicides that he will use in rice farming. 

Jerson desires to get better yield yearly to earn higher income and save some of it. He hopes to attain his desire in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and herbicides that he will use in rice farming.

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 33-year-old married woman and is a mother of two beautiful children, who she works hard to provide for with the best living ever. Mirvat has been a hairdresser for 15 years; she is a hardworking woman with a very good reputation. Mirvat is very friendly with her customers; they enjoy her work and insist on supporting her to improve her business as much as she can.

Mirvat is an A. Majmoua borrower for the second time. Her previous loan helped in improving her business and her sociA. and financiA. situations. This time, Mirvat is requesting a loan from Kiva Partner A. Majmoua to make her children's dream come true. She intends to buy them their dream bedroom, instead of having to sleep on a mattress on the floor. She hopes this brings happiness to their hearts. 

Mirvat also hopes to expand her business through opening a speciA. faciA. department, in addition to tattoo and speciA. makeup departments.

loans.use: to buy a bedroom for her children

loans.name: Roxana Estefa

texts.es: La señora Roxana es una cliente antigua de la institución, ella trabajo con grupo solidario en varias secuencia, luego se individualizó siendo esta su sexta secuencia, ella tiene la venta de helados en carrito en la zona de Mallasa, tiene también un deposito donde se encuentra su mercadería, ya que por esta temporada de calor sube bastante su venta, el esposo también se dedica a la venta de helados por la zona central, ellos tiene una casita que están construyendo poco a poco, ahí viven con una de sus hijas y sus nietos, la señora es una persona responsable, el dinero del cerdito lo utilizara en la compra de material de construcción para hacer terminar de construir su casita y así poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana is a long-standing client of the institution.  She worked with a community bank for several loan cycles then started taking out individual loans.  This is her sixth.

Roxana has an ice cream cart in Mallasa district.  She also has a storage place where she keeps her merchandise as, in this hot season, her sales rise quite a lot.  Her husband also sells ice creams in the central district.  The couple have a small house which they are gradually building.  They live there with one of their daughters and their grandchildren.  Roxana is a responsible person.  She will use her loan money to buy building supplies so that she can finish building her small house and thereby offer more comfort to her family.

loans.use: to buy building supplies so that she can finish building her small house

loans.name: Elgiba

texts.es:
La señora Elgiba es socia del banco comunal Bellavista del Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 60 años D. edad, está casada y tiene seis hijos.
Se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, son años que viene trabajando con los préstamos D. Manuel Ramos, solo uno D. sus hijos vive en su casa, pero ya es independiente económicamente. 
Con su nuevo préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles comprará: 10 cajas D. gaseosa, 7 paquetes D. gaseosas grandes, 5 paquetes D. agua mineral sin gas, 2 paquetes D. agua  con gas, pago D.  mano D. obra del pintado D. su congeladora.
Su negocio se ubica en su propia casa y no tiene que ausentarse D. su hogar para poder trabajar, su esposo también aporta al hogar, cuenta con un trabajo que le genera un buen sueldo que les es suficiente para los dos incluso para poder ahorrar, pero  quiere seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos porque ya es parte D. su familia.
texts.en:
Elgiba is a member of the communal bank Bellavista del Distrito D. Calleria, in the department of Ucayali. She is 60 years old, married with 6 children.

She works selling soft drinks. She has been woking for years with loans through Manuela Ramos. Only one of her children lives at home, but the child is economically independent. 

With this new loan of 3,000 soles she will buy 10 boxes of soft drinks, 7 cartons of large-size soft drinks, 5 packages of still mineral water, 2 packages of sparkling mineral water, and pay to have the icebox painted.

Her business is located in her own house and she does not have to leave home in order to work. Her husband also contributes to the house, with work that brings in good income which is enough for the two of them even to save some, but they continue working with Manuela Ramos because it is part of their family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is from the village of Disimuray. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Juliana started her sari-sari store (variety store) many years ago, and she earns approximately P500 (Philippine peso). According to Juliana, through the income she generates from her sari-sari store, she is able to support her family's needs.

Juliana wants to expand her family's business, so she is taking out this P20,000 loan to purchase additional stock such as canned goods, groceries, sugar, and other basic ingredients to sell.

Juliana hopes to grow and expand her general store to secure her family's future. She hopes to educate her children so that they will become professional someday. Despite the hardships of life, they are striving hard to earn and save for their education.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock such as canned goods, groceries, sugar, and other basic ingredients to sell.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling rugs in the Philippines.

Maria Theresa requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her rug business. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Maria Theresa would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her rug business.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.pt:
Natural de Maputo, casado maritalmente a 4 anos e pai de 4 filhos, dos quais uma já na idade escolar. Sustenta mais 3 pessoas sendo 2 (duas) sobrinhas e sua mãe.
Tem o negócio como sua actividade, sendo um cliente que já teve 3 financiamento e com o presente empréstimo pretende adquirir diverso produtos para comercialização (arroz, feijão, fósforo, velas etc) como forma de incrementar seu stock.
No futuro aspira ampliar cada vez mais a sua actividade e o seu maior desafio é juntar fundo suficiente para o efeito porque só assim poderá expandir o seu negócio
texts.en:
Ernesto was born in Maputo, has been married for 4 years and has 4 children, one of whom is already of school-going age. He supports 3 additional people - 2 (two) nieces and his mother.

He owns a business and is a client who has had loans from Hluvuku 3 times already. With the current loan he plans to buy various products to sell (rice, beans, matches, candles, etc) in order to increase his stock.

In future he aspires to expanding his commercial activities and his greatest challenge is having enough funds to do this.

loans.use: buy various products to sell (rice, beans, matches, candles, etc) in order to increase his stock.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a widow with five children.  She is a farmer, and has been farming for ten years. She is currently growing sunflowers, beans, maize, and sweet potatoes. She is looking forward to beekeeping as it will give her an opportunity to earn extra income.

This is Jackline’s first loan with Honey Care. She intends to use the proceeds from her beekeeping to pay for her children’s school fees and to provide for their basic needs. Jackline’s hope for the future is to produce more honey for more income generation.

Jackline lives in Sindo, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts, and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Dimitar

texts.en:
Dimitar (Mitko) was 7 years old when he started to play the saxophone. He played throughout childhood, studied music at Burgas University for four years and was subsequently in the Bulgarian military band for two years (1972-1974) during the cold war. After completing his military service he was a part of the Bulgarian National Orchestra, a small group that was allowed to travel around the Eastern Block highlighting Bulgarian culture. During this period, Mitko had to work hard to get copies of the music of his favorite Western musician, Louis Armstrong, as no Western music or books were allowed in Bulgaria.

After the state orchestra was dismantled, Mitko returned to his Roma neighborhood in Sliven. (The Roma, often referred to as gypsies in the West, are a severely marginalized group on the Balkan Peninsula of Southeastern Europe.) Now in his early 60s, he works Roma weddings and banquets from fall to the spring and Black Sea beach resorts in the summer.

This loan will enable Dimitar to purchase a new saxophone; the one he uses in this video is held together in parts by hair bands and paper clips. His repayment schedule has smaller payments in the winter while business is slow, and larger payments next summer to pay down debt more quickly as his income increases. Mitko has 2 kids – 29 and 27 – and 2 grandchildren as seen in the video.

A short video of Mitko can be seen here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OwdFzrFg9_4

loans.use: New saxophone

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en: Ilia A. has been licensed as an agricultural producer for five years but he has been in this kind of business for more than 15 years. He has his own farm in the town of Parvomai, Smolian district. It  provides water, electricity and infrastructure and is well supplied with all necessary farm equipment. He breeds 22 cows and 20 sheep and because of the increased demand of sheep’s milk he needs to buy some more sheep. The loan amount is $1200.

loans.use: To buy more sheep

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
For ten years, shoppers at the busy Pervomaiski market in Nikopol, Ukraine, have been able to purchase a variety of men’s clothing from Galina Z.. Galina sets up a nice display of sweaters, shirts, coats, and shoes at her kiosk and offers great prices to attract passing customers. Galina is divorced and works hard to provide for herself and her 14-year-old son. Currently she makes about $360 net profit per month – just enough to cover the basic expenses for two people living in Ukraine.

Galina has requested a loan for $1000 to help purchase more clothing inventory for her kiosk. This will allow her to maintain a good product selection and continue to earn an adequate income to support herself and her son.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Sing

texts.en: Mrs. Sing M. is 41 years old and lives in Pray Veng, Cambodia with her husband and their 7 children.  Mrs. Sing M. is a grocer, while her husband is a construction foreman.  One of their children works in a garment factory, and the total income of the household is around $6/day.  Mrs. Sing M. is doing very well in her grocery business, but she does not have enough capital to purchase more goods.  She will use this loan to buy more groceries for her inventory so that she can build up her store.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products

loans.name: Ni Made

texts.id:
Senior age did not lowered Made P. to expand her business. In the 50's even increased her efforts to add 2 pigs from 2 mother pigs that she has long worked on. Now Made P. owns 4 mother pigs that was bought from a loan she obtain from DINARI for Rp 1,300,000 (about US$150). All this she does since she is now not strong enough to help Wayan Mawan her husband as a tenant farmer working the land. However Made P. still wants to help add extra income to pay for the 3 children that are still within their responsibilities, by raising pigs, that do not need a lot of extra efforts, it is enough to feed them twice a day morning, and evening, and to take care of the baby pigs to keep them healthy. From the 4 mother pigs Made P. own, every six months she could profit an average of Rp 4,200,000 (aboutUS$ 450), so that her contribution income by raising pigs are about Rp700,000 (about $75)/month. From that she ease her husband's burden, and could save a little for her children and old age.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usia yang lanjut ternyata tidak menyurutkan semangat Made P. untuk mengembangkan usahanya. memasuki usia yang ke 50 tahun ini justru memicu semangatnya untuk menambah 2 ekor lagi dari 2 ekor induk babi yang sudah sejak lama di tekuni. Kini Made P. telah memiliki 4 ekor induk babi yang di beli dengan menggunakan uang pinjaman yg di peroleh dari DINARI Rp 1.300.000 hal ini dilakukannya karena sadar bahwa Made P. tak kuat lagi untuk bekerja membantu Wayan Mawan suaminya sebagai petani untuk menggarap tanah. namun begitu Made P. juga tetap ingin membantu memporoleh tambahan penghasilan untuk membiayai ketiga orang anak yang masih menjadi tanggungan keluarga ini dengan jalan memelihara babi yang tidak membutuhkan tenaga ekstra, dengan memberi makan 2 kali sehari pagi dan sore dan merawat anak –anak babi agar tetap sehat itu sudah cukup. namun hasil yang di dapat cukup lumayan . dari 4 ekor induk yang di miliki Made P. setiap enam bulan menghasilkan keuntungan rata –rata Rp 4.200.000 sehingga penghasilan tambahan yang di dapat oleh Made P. dari memelihara babi sebesar Rp 700.000/bln. dengan hasil inilah Made P. bisa membantu meringankan beban suaminya bahkan sekarang dia sudah bisa menabung sedikit demi sedikit untuk anaknya dan hari tuanya .

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock for fattening, and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi untuk penggemukan dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Aldevina Chipachane

texts.pt:
Aldevina is single and she has 2 children. She lives with them and they are both in school. Aldevina joined the program in 2002, but due to circumstances beyond her control, she got away from it for a while. Now, she is ready to return. She works for a private security company in the touristic area of Zongoene, located in the district Xai-Xai. If business goes well she will build an addition to her home to better accommodate her children.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Aldevina e solteira e tem 2 filhos. Ela vive sozinha com os seus filhos. Todos eles estao a estudar. Aldevina entrou parao Programa de credito em 2002, mas por razoes alheias a sua vontade ela parou por uns tempos. Agora ela esta a recomecar. Ela trabalha numa empresa de Seguranca Provada, numa itancia turistica chamada Zongoene lodge no distrito de Xai-Xai.. Se o negocio correr bem ela que ampliar a sua residencia, uma vez que os filhos estao a crescer.

loans.use: Aldevina wants to use the money to purchase bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
"I have a room in the back of my home that I would like to construct out of cement blocks so that we may inhabit it and so my children will be more comfortable. Our home is very small, we are a family of 5 and we no longer fit comfortably. I am requesting $1,200.00 to construct a room made of cement in my home."

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo un cuarto atrás de mi vivienda que me gustaria hacer de block, para poder habitarlo y que mis hijos esten más comodos ya que nuestra vivienda es muy pequeña y en mi familia somos 5 y ya no cabemos ”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para hacer un cuarto de block en mi vivienda

loans.use: Construct a room made of cement.

loans.name: Jose Estanilado.

texts.es:
Jose, 27, is a young campesino, born in Bluefields, single with one son. His father died several months ago and he lives with his mother and three sisters. He's head of the house now that his father is gone and he earns a living selling general merchandise. In order to add to the sales he gets from his small general store, he travels to various parts of town to sell his products, too. This young businessman is now studying nights at the university so that his days are free for going around the city selling his products. Like many businesses, this one needs financing to buy the products most required by its customers: sugar, cooking oil, soup, rice, beans, and "meneitos" (a local corn-based snack).

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Jose M. M. es un joven de 27 años de origen campesino, originario de Bluefields, soltero, tiene un hijo, vive con su mama y tres hermanas, ya que su padre fallecio hace algunos meses. Este joven se dedica a actividades de venta de granos basicos y productos varios. Tiene la responsabilidad de ser la cabeza de la familia por la ausencia de su padre. Para vender sus productos ademas de la pulperia que tiene, se dedica a visitar diferentes viviendas y poder incrementar sus ventas. Este joven comerciante esta actualmente estudiando en la universidad en horas de la noche por lo que todo el dia se moviliza por la ciudad ofertando sus productos. Pero al igual que muchos negocios necesita que le financien la compra de los siguientes productos que son los mas requeridos por sus clientes. 3 quintales de azucar la cual compra a US$ 27 dolares el quintal, 3 bidones de aceite a US$ 26 dolares el bidon, 1 cajas de sopa 3 minutos a US$ 24 dolares la caja, 3 quintales de arroz a US$ 44 dolares el quintal, 2 quintal de frijoles a US$ 81 dolar el quintal, y 1/2 bolson de meneitos a US$ 28 dolar el 1/2 bolson.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Tiira Road F Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Edith N.. She currently sells matooke (plantain) and is requesting a loan to purchase more matooke for sale. Edith is 28 years old and is married. She has 6 children ranging in age from 1.5 to 10 years and five of them go to school. Each week, Edith makes approximately UGX 35000 (US$20.00) in profits and, with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to pay school fees for the children. Edith has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 (US$118.00) to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Edith is joined in her small group by Sarah N. and Hadija N.. Both Sarah N. and Hadija N. sell used clothes and they wants a loan to increase their businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase mroe matooke for sale and make more profits

loans.name: Kyowamwino B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Grace N.. She is currently in the business of selling millet flour and is requesting a loan to boost business. Grace is 24 years old and is married. She has 3 children ranging from age 1 to 5 and most of her children go to school. Each week, Grace makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

Grace is joined in her small group by Rose A., Rosemary N., Ruth N., and Racheal K.. Rose A. has a business running a butcher's shop and wants to start trading hides and skins. Rosemary N. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to add more capital. Ruth N. operates a business buying and selling produce and wants to invest in her business. Racheal K. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to purchase in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase more flour to sell

loans.name: Naida's Maendeleo Group

texts.en:
Naida is 35 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 14 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other children, ages 9, 13 and another 13 years old. Naida owns a small grocery, which she started in 1998. Every day, she works from 6am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $425 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Salma, who has a business dealing in shoe sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene D. is twenty-seven years old. She is a wife and mother of two children aged six and four years old. She is the owner and operator of a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, rice, evaporated milk, assorted food spices, cooking oil, candies, biscuits, etc. Irene enjoys selling and works hard to support her family's needs. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, assorted biscuits, cooking oil, cartons of milk, and soaps to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called Steadfast Trust Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, assorted biscuits, cooking oil, cartons of milk, and soaps.

loans.name: Laxmi Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi Devi M. lives in Thecho village with her husband and four children. Five years ago, her husband left for India to earn more money. Her older son works in a private office and her younger son is studying in grade 9; as for her daughters, they too are studying, in grades 10 and 11, respectively.

Mrs. Laxmi Devi M. has been working in the handicraft profession for the past 6 years. More specifically, she makes different types of traditional idols, which are in high demand by her customers. However, due to a lack of funds, she is unable to meet the rising demands of her customers. So, Mrs. M. is requesting a loan in the amount of $225 (Rs 15,000) to buy raw materials such as wax, bronze, silver, etc. for her work.

loans.use: To meet her customers' demands by purchasing additional raw materials (e.g., wax, bronze, silver) that will go into her work

loans.name: Pelagia Aquelina

texts.es:
Ms. Pelagia M. is a woman farmer of humble origins who works incessantly on the arduous tasks of the fields. She works the land daily in order to support her family and her 7 school age children. For this reason, Ms. M. works arduously in her crop fields, where she grows potatoes, beans, olluco (an Andean potato), corn, wheat, oats, and barley. Despite the various losses they have suffered, Ms. M. and her family persevere, motivated by their desire for self-improvement. She is requesting a loan of 3000 Peruvian soles in order to purchase fertilizers so that she can prepare her land and improve the quality of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Pelagia es una mujer agricultora de condición humilde que trabaja incesantemente en las duras tareas del campo, labra la tierra diariamente para conseguir el sustento de su familia y el de sus 7 hijos que están en edad escolar. Por ello, Doña Pelagia trabaja arduamente en sus campos de cultivo, donde siembra papa, habas, olluco, maíz, trigo, avena y cebada. Doña Pelagia y su familia a pesar de las pérdidas que han venido sufriendo por diferente índole, perseveran, motivados por sus deseos de superación. Ella solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para poder comprar fertilizantes; y así pueda preparar y abonar su terreno para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers in order to improve the quality of her crops

loans.name: Tik

texts.en:
Mrs. Tik T., 41, is married with seven children and works as a rice farmer. She earns approximately three dollars per day. In her area, she can grow rice twice a year, dry season and rainy season. The process of growing rice in the dry season takes six months from planting to harvesting. In the rainy season, the process takes three months.

Mrs. Tik T. is requesting a loan to purchase piglets to breed during the time when she is not harvesting rice. This would provide her family with some additional income.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed for additional income.

loans.name: Wahida

texts.en:
Wahida is 37 years old. She is married with 3 children, aged between 13 and 5. She has been a food seller since 2003. Every day she works from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Wahida now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Marlita

texts.es: Marlita tiene 55 años, vive con su hermana, es madre de 6 hijos que están fuera del hogar, ya son independientes gracias a la educación y buenas costumbres que ella  las impartió como madre, se separó de su pareja y a pesar de esto, trabajo duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos de quienes se siente muy orgullosa. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas para contribuir con los gastos del hogar, debido al carisma con el que cuenta y la concurrencia de sus clientes se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar e implementar su negocio, es por eso que requiere de un capital para lograr su meta trazada. Con tu apoyo la señora Marlita logrará lo que quiere en el tiempo menos pensado.
texts.en:
Marlita is 55 years old, lives with her sister, and is the mother of 6 children that all live outside of the household. They are independent of her thanks to the education and good habits that Marlita has given them. She separated from her husband and in spite of this, she works hard to move forward along with her children, who she feels proud of. She makes a living by selling candies in order to contribute to the bills of the household. Due to her competitor and his charisma, she finds the need to grow and increase her business. This goal requires capital and with your support, Marlita will achieve what she would like with less difficulty.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up her business of selling candies

loans.name: Linda

texts.es:
La señora Linda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amigas por Siempre”, ubicado en el Jr. José Foqui Mz. Ñ Lt. 29, distrito de Yarinacocha, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y uno que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como ayudante en un aserradero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decide invertir en la venta de aguajina y productos regionales (Chancaca, fariña y otros).

En la actualidad se dedica al mismo negocio de “venta de productos naturales”. Linda trabaja de Lunes a Sábado desde la 10 a.m. a 2 p.m, lo cual le permite obtener buenas ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de fariña, 4 sacas de aguaje, 50 kilos de chancaca, 50 kilos de noni, etc.
  
Linda está feliz porque su negocio ha crecido y desea tener un puesto más grande para darle una mejor educación a su menor hijo.
texts.en:
Linda belongs to the "Amigas por Siempre" (Forever Friends) Communal Bank, located in the Jr. Jose Foqui Mz. ñ Lt. 29, Yarinacocha District, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 39 years old, is the mother of 3 children, 2 grown-up and one that still depends on her. She is also married and her husband works as an assistant in a woodmill. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos (300 soles-Peruvian currency), Linda decided to invest it on selling agujina, molasses, and coarse mandioc flour as well as other regional products.

Currently, she still works on the same business and also sells "natural products". Linda works from Monday to Saturday from 10 a.m. until 2 p.m. which allows her to obtain good earnings to pay her loan on time. With this loan of 1500 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will pay back in 5 months, Linda will buy a sack of coarse mandioc flour, 4 sacks of aguaje, 50 kilos of molasses, 50 kilos of noni, etc.

Linda is happy because her business has grown and wishes to have a bigger stall to provide her younger son with a better education


Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coarse mandioc flour, molasses, noni, etc.

loans.name: Obed

texts.es: E l señor Obed es un muchacho joven pero que conoce de responsabilidades y que hay que trabajar para lograr las metas que nos propongamos.El tiene una imprenta y esta solicitando el credito para realizar unos pagos a proveedores que tiene pendientes, y desea seguir creciendo en su negocio que empieza a dar frutos.
texts.en:
Mr. Obed R. is a young man who nevertheless knows about responsibility, and knows that we must work in order to achieve the goals that we set for ourselves. He has his own printing works, and he is requesting this loan in order to make payments that are outstanding to his suppliers. He hopes that his business, which is now starting to be fruitful, will keep growing.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay suppliers

loans.name: Miluska

texts.es: Miluska tiene 44 años,  es soltera y vive con sus padres. Su negocio es el transporte, tiene una línea de taxis, ella trata con choferes de autos para que trabajen con la licencia municipal que ella posee, su ganancia está en el pago por el derecho de entrar como parte de la línea de taxis, es por ello que Miluska ha crecido bastante durante este año, y para seguir con su crecimiento implementó en su oficina de control una pequeña tienda donde vende filtros, lubricantes, entre otros. Miluska  tiene grandes expectativas de crecer, y en el futuro implementar su tienda con la venta de repuestos, y convertirla en una gran tienda especializada en autos. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser una clienta puntual en sus pagos. En esta oportunidad invertirá en la compra, al por mayor, de aceite para autos.
texts.en:
Miluska is 44 years old, single, and living with her parents. She working in transportation and has a taxi line. She works with car drivers so that they can work with the municipal license that she has. Her earnings come from others paying her for the right of coming on as part of her taxi line and it is because of this that Miluska has grown her business so much during this year. In order to continue growing, she has set up a small shop in her control office where she sells filters, lubricants, and other things. Miluska is expecting a large amount of growth and in the future she plans to set up shop to sell spare parts and convert it into a big store specializing in cars. This is the first time she is requesting a loan with MFP, and she is committed to be being timely with her payments. At this time, she will invest in buying car oil wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oil for cars

loans.name: Botirjon

texts.en:
Botirjon N. is a 38-year-old cattleman who is married with three children. Owing to his father, who was a farmer, Botirjon has been associated with this business since he was young. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he fattens and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them.

Every day, Botirjon gets up early in the morning in order to feed his animals. And all day, until late at night, he is busy looking after the cattle. Botirjon says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with a proper education. Now, Botirjon would like to expand his business and purchase three cows. For this purpose, he has applied for 4000 Somoni ($ 1175 USD) and with your help he hopes to reach his aim.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Gisele

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
B. Gisele s’est mariée avec AMINOU Charles et ils ont quatre enfants ensemble qui s’appellent Sese, Carmen, Elise, et Hubert. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés. Gisele vend les produits de beauté et les mèches depuis 5 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au Marché Dantokpa, le marché principal de l’Afrique d’Ouest. Dans le futur elle voudrait renforcer ses fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Gisele B. is married to Charles AMINOU and they have four children together, named Sese, Carmen, Elise, and Hubert. All the children are in school. Gisele has been selling beauty products and weaves for 5 years. She supplies herself at the Marché Dantokpa, the principal market in West Africa. In the future, she would like to strengthen her basic working capital. The meaning of ALIDE in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "there is always a path for the poorest." Benin is a small country in West Africa next to Nigeria, and its GDP per capita is $1,500. ALIDE offers special zero-interest loans to highly vulnerable people, and it is part of a group that will soon launch a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell beauty products

loans.name: Glenis

texts.es: Glenis de 26 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su conviviente, ella es madre de 3 hijos los cuales vienen estudiando. La señora Glenis es propietaria de 2 mototaxis, los cuales manejan ella y su conviviente, quienes se dedican al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 2 años atrás para cubrir con todos los gastos de su hogar. Lo que a ella le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y sobre todo se relaciona con varias personas, haciendo muchas amistades, quienes recomiendan el servicio de Glenis, ella considera muy rentable su labor ya que sus dos herramientas de trabajo le generan muy buenos ingresos económicos,  los cuales administra ella, haciéndolo de la mejor forma para que alcance a cubrir los gastos diarios y del mes. Ella quiere mas adelante comprar otro mototaxi y empelar a una persona que lo necesite y así generar un puesto de trabajo. Glenis ya tiene 7 préstamos en MFP y es muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que  le gusta trabajar con sus amigas de su banco comunal. Con el dinero del préstamo mandará a reparar sus herramientas de trabajo, comprando repuestos y motores generando un gasto de 1800 soles, el dinero restante lo ahorrará para comprar un mototaxi de segundo uso.
texts.en:
Glenis is 26 years old, lives in her own house with her boyfriend, and is the mother of three children in school. Glenis is the owner of two motorcycle taxis, which she and her boyfriend drive. They have been working in transportation for two years to cover their household expenses. What she likes best about her job is getting to know many places--and most of all, meeting new people and making friends who recommend her services. She considers this work very profitable as her two vehicles generate a very good income, which she administers, so it's the best way to cover her daily and monthly costs. In the future, she wants to buy another motorcycle taxi and employ another person, thus generating a new job. Glenis has had seven loans through MFP. She is very punctual in her repayments, and enjoys working with her friends at the communal bank. With this loan, she will repair her two motorcycles, buying spare parts and engines at a cost of 1800 soles. She will save the remaining money to purchase another motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motorcycle repairs

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouman est composé d’une célibataire et de trois  femmes mariées vivant dans des familles monogamiques. Âgées en moyenne de 33 ans avec 2 enfants, elles vivent toutes dans le quartier Ségou Coura Somono de la ville de Ségou (4ème région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et professionnel et font le commerce d’articles divers (riz, habits, tubercules, bijoux,  bracelets, chaînes, boucles d’oreille  etc.). 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé  d’adhérer au programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt  pour acheter,  70 pièces de pagnes wax, 10 couvres lits, 25 sacs de riz et  50 caisses de pomme de terre. Elles se ravitaillent en pièces de pagnes wax et en couvres lits au grand marché de Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali), en riz à Niono  et quant à la  pomme de terre, elle  est livrée à domicile par des forains Sikassois sur commande. Elles vendent en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes à domicile et en ambulant.
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42250FCFA qui servira au remboursement des intérêts  du prêt, et subvenir aux charges familiales (éducation, santé) et sociales (mariages, baptêmes et funérailles).
Elles ont pour objectif, l’ouverture d’une boutique de vente en gros à Ségou.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouman is composed of four women (one unmarried and four married) living in monogamous families. Averaging 32 years of age and 2 children each, the women all live in the Ségou Coura Somono district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community and profession and do commerce in various goods (rice, clothing, tubers, jewelry, chains, earrings, etc.)

Concerned with doing better in satisfying their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program, with which they are on their seventh solidarity loan (group loan). All the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. They intend to use this loan to buy: 70 bolts of Wax pagnes, 10 bed spreads, 25 sacks of rice, and 50 cases of potatoes. Supplies of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and bed spreads are gotten at the marketplace of Bamako (capital of Mali). The rice is gotten in Niono, and the potatoes are home-delivered by Sikasso vendors by special order. Sales are made at the house and door-to-door to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 42,250 francs CFA that will be used for making loan interest payments and for cover family expenses (education, health) and social expenses (marriage, baptisms, funerals). Their objective is to open a wholesale shop in Ségou.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, rice, and potoates

loans.name: Saidniso

texts.en:
M. Saidniso has applied for her first loan with MicroInvest in 2009 but she has shown herself to be a serious and reliable client. Saidniso lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan and she is married with a pretty little child.

Saidniso is engaged in the selling of sweets (candies) and sugar in the local bazaar. She works with direct suppliers from Iran and so sells at lower prices than the bazaar prices. She has been engaged in this business for 5 years.

Saidniso is applying to Kiva with the request of a business development loan of 1,600 STJ for 6 months to import a new assortment from Uzbekistan. This will make her assortment better and increase the business turnover.

Saidniso thanks Kiva for assisting with small business development and support.

loans.use: To import a new assortment from Uzbekistan

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Since 1994, Deborah A. has worked as a baker at Kojokrom near Shama Junction, selling bread. She is married with three children. She received an education through senior high school. Deborah uses her income to pay for various family expenses, particularly the water bill. She will use this loan to purchase additional bread baking necessities and therefore produce more goods. With the new profits from her expanded business, Deborah plans to start saving her money at the bank and also to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional bread baking necessities

loans.name: Luu Thi

texts.en:
Huế Lưu Thị (1430081634) is 24 years old and lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has a baby. Huế owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising cattle for sale. Huế has just started operating this business and earns approximately 20,00,000 VND a month from doing so.

In 2008, Huế joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Huế has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to expand shelter for her livestock.

Huế is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the second loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Huế plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89344&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Luz Maria es socia del bancomunal Maria de la Paz, continúa con su negocio es dar servicio de taxi “TAXI 1” 
En Finca, aprendió a invertir, siente que es un apoyo  económico.
Necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de llantas y mantenimiento al motor de otro de sus carros, el que su esposo lo maneja.
El sueño de Maria, es terminar su carrera de podología  y comprar otro carro.
texts.en:
First loan:: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89344&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Luz Maria is a member of the Maria de la Paz Community Bank. She continues her business of taxi service, “Taxi 1”. In Finca she learned to invest. She feels it is an economic support. She needs a loan for 1,400 PEN to buy tires and do maintenance on the motor of one of her other cars, which he husband drives. Maria’s dream is to finish her career in podiatry and buy another car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Motor maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cattle to fatten

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres en Victoria son personas luchadoras con muchas esperanzas de superarse, ellas son vecinas cercanas. Sra. Esperanza M. es la lider del grupo, ella tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, sus hijos tienen 7 y 2 años de edad. Tiene un año de dedicarse a su negocio el cual es venta de golosinas como ser, tacos, platanos fritos con frijoles, baleadas, pollo frito, refrescos naturales y de botella, ahora ella cocina en su estufa pero va a usar el prestamo para comprarse una freidora.
la sra. Claudia es dueña de una pulperia en donde vende productos como ser pan, pastas, jabones, apomitas de maiz, sopas, refrescos, huevos, lactesos etc. ella tiene 24 años de edad y tiene dos hijos los cuales tienen 8 y 6 años de edad.
sra. Doris tiene un puesto de frutas y ahi vende minimos, aguacates y sandillas, ella esta ubicada en un lugar en donde pasa mucha gente, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas frutas, tambien ella quiere empezar a comprar lacteos para vender como queso, quesillo, mantequilla, requeson.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus familias y sus hogares.
texts.en:
The Women in Victory are tough people with great hopes of improving themselves. They are close neighbors. Mrs. Esperanza M., 30, is the group leader, a single mother with kids ages 7 and 2. She's spent a year on her business, which sells sweets, tacos, fried bananas with beans, fried chicken, natural refreshments, bottled soft drinks, etc. For now she cooks with her stove, but she's going to use the loan to buy herself a deep fryer. Mrs. Claudia is owner of a local store where she sells products like bread, pastas, soap, soups, drinks, eggs, dairy products, etc. She's 24 and has two kids, ages 8 and 6. Mrs. Doris has a fruit stand, and sells there avocados and watermelons. She's located in a place where many people pass by. She needs a loan to buy more fruit; she also wants to start buying dairy to see cheese, butter, and cottage cheese. All of them need the loan to be able to improve the situations of their families and homes.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fryer and merchandise

loans.name: Zagdsuren

texts.en:
Zagdsuren N. is a 49 year old married woman who has three children. She is a professional barber. She used to work for a privately held company as a barber. As her clients are very satisfied with her haircut service, she thought it would be more profitable if she opened her own barber shop. In 1990 she opened a small barber shop near the local market and now she has many repeat clients.

Zagdsuren says that "I couldn't let my two eldest daughters graduate from university because of our family's inability financially. Thus I really want my youngest one to graduate from the university. I've already started saving small amounts for my youngest one's tuition." With this loan she will buy a hair dryer and other equipment for her barber shop.

loans.use: To buy hair dryer and other equipment for her barber shop.

loans.name: Doris Marlene

texts.en:
Doris has a small home-based grocery shop. Doris has had her shop for two years and has invested all of her recent loans from Manuela Ramos, a Kiva field partner, in products to sell. She will do the same with his loan of 1500 soles. When Doris first started working with Manuela Ramos in 2004, she sold only beer, soft drinks and popsicles. Now that she has her little store, she sells many other items. 

Doris is married and has three children, ages 23, 20 and 13, and a two-year-old granddaughter, all of whom live with her. Doris’s husband is a regional salesman for a company based in Lima, the capital of Peru.

Doris's business has been doing reasonably well. She manages to repay her loans without problems and is very careful to request only as much as she knows she can repay.
 
Doris tends to sell more when school is in session. Many students walk by her shop on their way to class and stop to buy snacks. Doris uses all of the profits from her shop to help her family, particularly her children. Doris feels that her credit from Manuela Ramos has helped her a lot. Although representatives from many other small banks and microfinance institutions have come by her shop to offer her loans, she wants to work only with Manuela Ramos.

In this short video clip, Doris talks about her goal of expanding both the size of her shop and the types of groceries that she offers.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Doris Marlene  from  Peru

loans.use: Products for a general store.

loans.name: Poor, No Friend Group

texts.en:
Poor, No Friend is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Krubo K., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Krubo is married with 5 children, age 2-7.  Krubo is 33 years old, illiterate, and lives in nearby Borkeza Town.  

Krubo’s business is palm oil wholesale.  Palm oil is used for cooking and making soap.  Krubo sells in the Bokeza market and other markets in a stall alongside other vendors.  She has been running her business for 3 years.  Today her business is only open when she has inventory, even though the demand is constant.  

She’s taking a loan to increase her inventory sufficiently so she can keep her business open year-round and increase her sales beyond Bokeza market.  With the profits she dreams of building a market out of her house, and investing in the future of her kids.  She especially wants to send them to school, as she was unable to attend.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene D. is from Tinago Ozamiz City. She is 37-years-old, married, and has two adult children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for her store comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. She has been engaged in this activity for more than two years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Arlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that could help improve her business. She is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Arlene’s first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the overall living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita H., who lives in the village of Vasquez Ext., Brgy. Carabalan Road, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental, is a 64-year-old widow and mother of 12 children, seven of whom already have their own families, while five of the younger children still live at home. As a widow for sometime now, she is used to feeding such a large family and has gained her community's respect because of the way she has raised her children to have integrity and moral fiber.

When Melita was widowed, she had to rely on the income from her general store. To augment her only source of income, Melita decided to make use of her cooking skills and expanded her business to include food vending, and this additional venture enabled her to support her children. But as her capital became insufficient to generate the income to cover the family's needs, Melita decided to join NWTF-Project Dungganon after she heard from some of her friends about how it could help her. After getting her children's agreement, she joined NWTF-PD in 1990.

The loans from NWTF-PD enabled her to expand the operations of her general store and food vending business. Using her dressmaking skills, she also started making ready-to-wear dresses to sell to her neighbors, and the cumulative income allowed her to support the education of her children. Three of her children have helped out in the family expenses since they graduated from school and began earning their own income. Her business now nets her an average profit of PHP 2,000 per month.

In her previous loan she borrowed Php 11,000 which she used as additional capital for the general store and food-vending business. The loan was fully repaid on time. She plans to use her 16th cycle loan amounting to PHP 11,000 to purchase additional items for her RTW business and the general store. The income from these will be used for her food-vending business.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a mere $1 a day, to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her ready-to-wear clothing business and her general store

loans.name: Silveria

texts.es:
Silveria, de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con una chacra que queda a dos días de viaje en bote por río, donde ha sembrado 3 hectáreas de fríjoles, 5 de papayas y 1 de plátanos. Silveria está muy contenta porque en el caso de las papayas, producen todos los días, mientras que el fríjol y los plátanos son por temporada, obteniendo buenas ganancias por sus frutas.

Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es mantenerse activa y le es rentable, además cada vez que va a su chacra aprovecha para llevar ropa de segundo uso que compra en la ciudad, la cual vende a sus vecinos de cultivo o la intercambia por gallinas o pescados salados, los mismos que vende en cuanto regresa a su casa. 

Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos son personas cumplidas y trabajadoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita contratará personal para ampliar y preparar su chacra (5 cuadras), donde sembrara maíz y yuca.
texts.en:
Silverio, 43, is a single mother. She lives with her two children in her own house. She has been farming for three years. She has a small farm, which she gets to by a two day trip by boat on the river. This is where she plants three hectares of beans, five of papaya, and one of bananas. Silveria is very happy because the papayas produce every day while the beans and bananas are seasonal. She gets good income from her fruits. What she likes most about her work is staying active, and it is profitable for her. Every time she goes to the farm she takes the opportunity to take second hand clothing with her. She buys it in the city and sells it to her farming neighbors. Sometimes she exchanges it for chickens or salted fish, which she sells when she returns home. This is her fourth loan with MFP. What she likes about her communal bank is that all of the people are accomplished and hard-working. With the money she is now asking for she will hire people to expand and prepare her farm (five blocks) where she plants corn and yucca.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion and preparation of her fields

loans.name: Erina's Group

texts.en:
N. Erina has a drugstore that she is running and, since she is the only one in her locality with this business, she is a necessity for her customers. She has had the drugstore for four years and, although it is doing well, she still needs to stock up on drugs that are missing due to her limited cash on hand; hence, the need for a loan.

Erina is young, hardworking and devoted with a lot of goals for the future. She is a single lady with no children yet. She believes that if she is to find a good husband and have kids they'll want a smooth landing, and that is why she is working so hard. She is the leader of her group in Mukono.

loans.use: To restock her drugstore

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn T. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Genelyn owns and operates a business buying and selling fish, shellfish and crabs in the local community. Genelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

Genelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Genelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This this will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon Group

texts.en:
The Sagrado Corazon committee is on its second loan. It is made up of twenty very hardworking women, many of whom are single mothers.

In this Group, the loans are used for the individual businesses of the members, which include, the recycling of paper, coal and plastics, buying ingredients for baked goods and pastries, such as the Paraguayan national “empanada”, fruits and vegetables, cosmetics such as lipsticks, creams, shampoos and deodorants, candy, fabric for tailoring clothing, bed sheets and towels, skirts and shorts, herbs and remedies, sausages and sweetmeats.

The women in this committee are all very experienced entrepreneurs and share the goals of overcoming poverty and succeeding in bettering their livelihoods.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is 52 years old. She is divorced and has given birth to five children. All have completed basic school but could not continue due to financial problems. Adwoa lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim, which is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the local people. Adwoa is a trader. She trades in foodstuffs such as yam, plantain, cassava, etc. She buys from nearby communities and treks to sell in nearby towns. She also supplies to local food vendors. Adwoa has been in this business for ten years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs

loans.name: Gnor

texts.en: Gnor S., 39, was married many years ago but she doesn’t have children and she plans to have a child next year. She lives with her husband in a wooden house located in Phnom Penh city, where she earns a living by working in the field of construction for a small firm. Gnor S. is married to Mr. Romlor, who is 43 years old, and currently assists his family by working as a building foreman. Gnor S. has requested a loan to buy a used motorbike, which will allow her and her husband to commute to work.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en: Marilou P. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Marilou owns and operates a business selling coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,200 PHP a month. In 2006, Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim R., 49, lives with her husband and three children in Takeo province. To earn a living, she has been working in her rice field growing rice and raising animals. On average, she makes about US $2 of profit a day. Her husband has a business collecting sugar palm juice and refining it to sell in the market. Three of their children work as construction workers. Sim R. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase cows to help her in the rice field.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Bwizi Livestock Marketing Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en:
Jackson M. is 45 years old and the leader of his lending group in Kyenjojo. He appears in the small photo at the top left just like in the big photo and he is a very hard working and friendly man with 7 children, 5 of them still in school as he takes care of two dependents.

Jackson is involved in the business of goat selling from Benga Bwizi subcounty and he is able to make weekly profits of 45,000. He believes that once his business expands, his income and profits will also rise. He hopes to become a strong business person and with the loan, he hopes to expand his business operations for more profit, by buying more goats for reselling.

loans.use: To buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a 42-year-old single mother of two children. She has been running an embroidery business for five years at the Jericho market. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, her business has grown, as have her profits after taking a loan of KES 10,000. She dreams of further expanding her business and venturing into another form of business in the future.  She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy cloth materials / fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Gunne

texts.en:
Gunne M., currently in the business of selling tea and bread, is requesting a loan to stock more sugar. Gunne, 22 years old and married to a policeman, is the mother of one child who does not yet go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rental purposes.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more sugar

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en:
Virginia B., from the village of Siparok, is the 48-year-old leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Virginia, who is married to a farmer, operates a business selling fish in the market and nearby Barangays. Engaged in her enterprise for over 11 years, she earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase additional fish and to use as working capital, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell.

location.town: Liloy-Siparok, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar M. and her husband share the responsibility of providing for their four children, whose ages range from one to six years old. Maricar has her own small hog-fattening business, which she established with a loan from Kiva partner, ASHI, in 2009. Her husband drives a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for transportation that he rents from a neighbor.
The income earned by the couple is not enough to give their children enough proper food for their nourishment. They can only buy the cheapest and most common food in the market and their locality. Therefore, Maricar wants to obtain a larger amount of capital through a loan to grow her hog-fattening business. She wants to fatten and sell a large volume of hogs in the market to earn more profit, which will be used to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for fattening

loans.name: Leonora Jarantilla Group

texts.en:
Leonora J., aged 59, is from the village of Kauswagan. She is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Leonora is married and has three adult children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2000, Leonora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 16th loan she has taken out  from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is married with two children. She has been in business trading in slippers for over eleven years now. She owns a stall along one of the busy streets in Makeni. She is very hard working and determined to succeed in business. For this reason, Zainab is seeking a loan to be able to buy goods that will increase her capital and then her profit. She intends to use the proceeds from the loan to educate her children up to university level and to build a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy shoes for her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients for the production of peppers

loans.name: Carmen Diana

texts.es:
Carmen Diana V. Q. tiene 27 años. Es soltera y vive con su hijo, Sebastián de 11 años, en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Carmen es una socia de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes.  Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Carmen es maestra en la escuela “Altos de Bucay”. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos, que comprara en el comisariato de Bucay. Su sueño es obtener una granja para sus animales.
texts.en:
Carmen Diana V. Q. is 27 years old. She is single, and she lives with her 11 year old son, Sebastián. They live in the Chillanes canton in the Bolívar province. Carmen is a member of the Santa Rosa Communal Bank, which is an hour and a half from the Chillanes canton. There are 18 members in all. Most of them have their own businesses. This is their first loan with the Cooperativa San José. Carmen is a teacher at the Altos de Bucay School. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs. She will buy the pigs from the Bucay market. Her dream is to have a farm for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say K., 56, is married and lives with two of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1 each day and are supported by one child working in a garment factory. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation also has been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Say K. included. 

Say K. would like to take out a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of flour, sugar, onions, oil, and beans to sell

loans.name: Rosita's Group

texts.en:
Rosita M. is from the village of Tipan Oroq. City Misamis Occidental. She is 67 years old. Rosita is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While the members of the group each receive an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rosita is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a business selling charcoal in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to buy more charcoal. This will be Rosita's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to help meet the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe N. is 40 and married with two children. She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Lupe has many years of experience in this business. Lupe needs a loan of 2000 talas to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 650 talas or US$ 251 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Lupe joined SPBD. This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lupe's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Molek

texts.en: Molek N. is 53 years old. She is widow and has three sons, two of whom help her in the household. Molek was the fourth child in a large, low-income family. Because she had to help her mother in the household from early childhood, Molek left secondary school after the 7th grade and started to work as a dairymaid. When Molek got married, she gave a birth to her beloved children. In 2003, her family met a hard blow – her husband died and Molek became the only bread-winner for the family. She decided to start her business in cattle breeding, since she had been engaged in cattle breeding for a long time and had a wide experience in this activity. She worked hard and managed to develop her farm: today she has three milk cows, one bull, one horse and twenty-two sheep. Her sons help her in pasturing and maintaining her livestock. In 2009, Molek obtained her first loan from Bai Tushum and Partners and repaid it without any delays. Now, she is applying for a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy two more milk cows in order to increase her milk sales. Molek is a very positive person so she believes that her strong efforts will help to improve her family’s standard of living. About Bai-Tushum and Partners: Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase two more milk cows

loans.name: Salvador De Jesus

texts.es: Salvador De Jesús es un hombre de 57 años, la necesidad lo ha impulsado a obtener su propio negocio de de venta de mercadería en general. Este es su primer Financiamiento con Fundación planea comprar una amplia variedad de productos como pantalones, cosméticos, calzado y oro está necesitando de este capital de trabajo adicional para responderles a sus clientes que le solicitan variedad. El buen carisma que ofrece es lo que hace que obtenga más clientes y un mercado mejor segmentado. Su sueño es llegar a tener una tienda, en donde pueda ofertar diferentes productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Salvador de Jesus is a 57 year old man. The need for work empowered him to set up his own business, selling general merchandise. This is his first loan from Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) and he plans on purchasing a wide variety of products such as pants, cosmetics, shoes, and gold. He requires working capital to be able to fill his clients' demand for variety.  He is able to win new clients with his wonderful charisma, reaching various sectors of the market. His dream is to have a store where he will be able to sell various products to his clients.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy essential materials.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann S. is 18-years-old. She is newly married to Rufus Mathe. She is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land, which she has been doing for one year.

Ann learned about KADET from other women who are already registered as clients. This will be her first loan. She is planning to increase her production by purchasing more seeds and insecticides. With the profits she hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to and expand her business from small scale to large scale farming.

Her future dream is that she will be able to build her own house and be the best farmer in her area. Ann also believes she is hard working and she only needs the resources to attain her goals.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds and insecticide.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora se dedica  a confección de ropas sobre pedidos, también uniformes para empresas, y de ropas para negocios en gran cantidad.
Comenta que gracias a la buena calidad de sus trabajos constantemente cuenta con mucho trabajo y pedidos de sus confecciones.
En ocasiones contrata mano de obra, cuando ella sola no puede con todos los pedidos. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de otra maquina de coser eléctrica  para usar cuando los pedidos aumentan.
texts.en:
This lady works making clothes to order.  She also makes uniforms for companies and a large quantity of clothes for businesses.

She comments that thanks to the good quality of her work, she constantly has a lot of work and orders for her clothes.

She sometimes hires workers when she can't manage all the orders on her own.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy another electric sewing machine to use when her orders increase.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Safia Muhammad Hussain's Group

texts.en:
