Safia is a resident of a small city called Okara, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan. She lives with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area called Mehboob town. She moved there four years ago. Safia has two sons. Her elder son is four years old and the younger one is only four months old. She is a caring lady who carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and pays full attention to her sons.
Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to assist her husband financially in his construction supplies sales business. With the loan, he will buy sand, bricks and cement in bulk in order to provide a better service to his customers and to fulfill larger orders on time. Safia is hopeful that an investment will be profitable for her husband’s business and make him more income. She is a new loan applicant to Asasah and this is her first loan application.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Kifah

texts.en:
Kifah lives in Jenin and works with his family in agriculture. He is 21 years old and he had to pause studying after high school and start working. When Kifah decided to resume studying, he was admitted to school and could pay first year tuition fees from his savings. Now he has come to FATEN for a loan to pay for next year's fees.

Kifah is an ambitious young man who wants to get his degree and keep helping his family working on the farm they have.

Kifah appears in the picture above in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To pay college tuition fees

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; ella tiene 30 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza de las marcas Esika,Avon,Dupre y Unique, la socia lleva años en este negocio siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento la socia vende a sus familiares ,amigos y vecinos ,ella se siente feliz en este negocio ya que le permite hacer lo que le gusta pero también espera poder encontrar otro tipo de trabajo más adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos de belleza para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the "VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Alicia is 30 years old, married and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling Esika, Avon, Dupre and Unique beauty products.  She has been in this business for years and it is the only activity that she carries out at the moment.  She sells to family members, friends and neighbors.  Alicia is happy with her business as it allows her to do what she likes doing but she is also hoping to find another type of work in the future.

Alicia is requesting this loan to buy more beauty products for her business.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her business

loans.name: Viviana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Viviana es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una de las comunidades urbano-marginales el distrito de Pimentel, un distrito cuyo atractivo principal es un balneario turístico situado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir para todo público. Ella adquiere prendas de vestir en la ciudad de Lima y la ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos por pedidos. Viviana suele trabajar tanto al crédito como al contado y su negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Viviana desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de prendas de vestir de temporada de verano de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.
texts.en:
Viviana is a 35 year-old mother who lives together with her husband and their children in one of the semi-urban communities in the district of Pimentel.  The principal tourist attraction in Pimentel district is a water park located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Viviana sells items of clothing to the general public.  She buys her merchandise in the city of Lima and offers it for sale to her neighbors and acquaintances by taking orders.  She works on credit as well as for cash and her business has allowed her to help her husband meet the economic needs of their family.

Viviana would like to expand her business with the purchase of fashionable garments for the summer season, in order to satisfy the current demand.  This is why she decided to request a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This loan will help her to meet her goal.

loans.use: to buy summer garments to resell

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: La Sra. María Elena D. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se dedica a atender su propio negocio que consiste en una pequeña  pulpería  desde hace cinco años. La Sra. ha demostrado tener un buen comportamiento en sus pagos durante los cuatro años que tiene de trabajar con nuestra institución, el crédito lo solicito para surtir mas su negocio ya que se avecina la entrada a clases y ella abastece las necesidades de los alumnos, maestros ya que su negocio está ubicado cerca del colegio de su comunidad ofreciéndoles golosinas, también comidas rápidas  como enchiladas, bigoron entre otros derivados alimenticios.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Elena D. is from the town of El Sauce.  She has been operating a small grocery store for the last five years.  María has been very good at paying back loans to our institution over the last four years.  

She plans to use this loan to stock her business since school is about to begin and she sells to the students and teachers there.  Her store is close to the community school where she sells sweets, fast food such as enchiladas, and other food items.

loans.use: To buy sweets, rice, sugar and bread

loans.name: Miramar Femenino 2 Group

texts.es:
Yesenia es L. coordinadora del Grupo Miramar Femenina 2. Su familia está compuesta por 4 hijos y su esposo, ambos (padre y madre) han educado y criado a sus hijos. Nos dice que sus retos o desafíos más difíciles ha echar su negocio hacia adelante, ya que resulta difícil mantener cualquier negocio si no hay un enfoque a crecer y superar todos los retos. 

Yessenia está muy emocionada D. recibir su cuarto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional.  ElL. ha tenido su negocio por alrededor D. 5 años. Hasta ahora Yesenia ha vendido solo carne D. res, en L. actualidad desea invertir este nuevo préstamo en L. compra D. pollos y cerdo, y poder comprar con un mayor capital, a un mejor suplidor. ElL. va a utilizar sus ganancias para cubrir algunas necesidades en su familia y aprovechar para ahorrar. 

Está asociada D. Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque deseas echar su negocio adelante, el cual requería D. capital para crecer. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia L. República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en L. República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en L. ciudad D. Santo Domingo, en una D. las comunidades D. mas escasos recursos ubicada al norte D. L. ciudad.
texts.en:
Yesenia is the coordinator of the 'Miramar Femenina 2' group.  Her family consists of her four children and her husband.  Both of them (father and mother) have educated and raised their children.  Yesenia tells us that her most difficult challenge has been getting ahead in her business since it is difficult to keep any business going if there is no focus on growing and overcoming challenges.

Yesenia is very excited to be receiving her fourth loan from Esperanza Internacional.  She has had her business for around 5 years.  Up until now, Yesenia has only sold beef.  She would like to invest this new loan in buying chickens and pigs.  She would also like to be able to buy with more capital from a better supplier.  She will use the profits she makes to cover some of her family's needs and will also save some money.

Yesenia started working with us because she wanted to get ahead in her business which needed capital in order to grow.  We are using her story to represent the other members of her group and Esperanza's clients in general, both the Haitians (who have mainly emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) and the Dominicans.  In general they live in very poor communities.  This area, like many other poor areas of the Dominican Republic, lacks a reliable supply of drinking water and electricity.  This group is located in the city of Santo Domingo, in one of the poorest communities, in the north of the city.

loans.use: To expand and diversify her meat products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase corn

loans.name: Tsendmaa

texts.en:
Tsendmaa, 40, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Dornod province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they have owned for the past five years. Tsendmaa's husband operates a transportation service and earns 250,000 MNT monthly from his business. Her older daughter attends a local high school and her youngest son goes to kindergarten.

Tsendmaa began operating a business making clothing in 2006. She decided to operate her own workshop as people are getting more and more interested in wearing traditional clothes such as deels, Mongolian traditional coats, vests, and traditional dresses for every kind of special occasion. Tsendmaa gets more custom orders during the holidays. Her current working capital is 1,200,000 MNT. She wants to further expand her business and have her own workshop in the future. Tsendmaa is a hardworking and modest person who says, "I want my children to have a good education. By making more profit, I would like to restore our house and have my own workshop." She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more textiles and cloth for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more textiles and cloth

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is currently in school.  Phiona has a business selling clothes, which she has had for three years.  She also has a second, small retail shop  business.

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Phiona hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  

In the future, Phiona hopes to own a plot of land and build a house.   Phiona is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine N. is 32 years old and lives in the town of GABA in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has two children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Justine has a small retail shop, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like sugar and maize flour for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Justine hopes to expand her business into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as sugar and maize flour.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia started her business making beautiful flower arrangements and selling them from a street cart two years ago, after hearing about Grameen America from a friend. At that time, she worked in a store that required her to put in long hours yet paid her barely enough to support her family. Now, she has created a profitable business and discovered a profession that she truly enjoys.

Claudia is a natural saleswoman who exudes friendliness and humor, so it’s not surprising that her favorite part of the job is getting to meet and converse with new people throughout the day. Having paid off her first two Grameen America loans, Claudia is seeking a third loan of $2,000 to purchase flowers and other equipment that she needs to grow her business. She hopes to one day apply her skills to opening a neighborhood flower shop. When Claudia isn’t hard at work expanding her business, she likes to relax at home and spend time with her son. Her dream for him is that he studies hard and builds a successful career – and Claudia is doing an incredible job of leading him by example.

loans.use: to purchase flowers and tools for her flower arrangements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing materials for resale and cattle which she will resell later on.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos en edad escolar.  La señora estudio la secundaria.
La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora  con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  ella requiere de un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en su negocio de compra y venta de ganados vacunos y ovinos, comprará una vaca en la localidad de Ilave.  En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo e hijos, también cuenta que hacen chacra como: papa, quinua y chuño.
Su sueño es tener ganados mejorados y así generar mayores ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es  la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Sisters of Choquetanca II Communal Bank, located in the Llave district, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 41 years old, married and has three children of school age, she finished high school.

Mrs. María is a new member that has recently become a part of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos, she needs a loan of S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles. The money will be used in her business of buying and selling cattle, sheep and pigs, she will buy a cow in the Llave area. María works with her husband and children since they also harvest potatoes, quinoa and “chuño” (a type of potato).

Her dream is to have better cattle to have more profits.

What Ofelia enjoys about her Communal Bank is the ease of her payments.

loans.use: buy a cow.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 34 años, reside en la comunidad del Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí formó su familia junto a Medait, su esposa, desde hace 5 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos Jean y Manuel, a los que educan y cuidan con mucho amor en casa de su mamá. Desde muy pequeño Wilfredo aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras heredadas de parte de ellos, un promedio de 5 hectáreas de los cuales por falta de capital solo siembra 3 cuadras de extensión, en donde cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Él siembra Café y plátano, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced ó a la cooperativa de su localidad. Ahora está en plena cosecha, donde está segura podrá obtener buenas ganancias. Además de tener un apoyo con la venta de los viveros que realiza; vendiendo el millar a S/. 400 soles. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos.  Y en sus tiempos libres se dedica a pulir madera y sacar planchones de tablas, ganando así un dinero extra. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera el apoyo financiero que tanto necesita. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Wilfredo de obtener su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de canastas y el pago del salario a los peones que le están apoyando en la cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 34, lives in the community of Palomar (Peruvian Central Jungle).  He formed his family there with Medait, his wife for the last five years.  They have two children, Jean and Manuel, that they educate and care for with much love in his mother’s house.

Since he was a little boy, Wilfredo learned how to work the land alongside his parents who taught him everything needed to know to produce good crops.  Now, he has his own land part of which was inherited from them.  He has about 5 hectares on average but due to lack of capital only farms coffee and bananas with much care and patience only on 3 "cuadras" (240 sq. m. approx) of land.  He takes his harvested crops to the central market in La Merced or to his local cooperative to sell.

He is currently in the height of the harvest season and is sure to have good profits.  In addition, he earns extra money selling seedlings; he sells them at 400 soles per one thousand.

What he most enjoys about his work is harvesting his crops because he feels that his hard work is having good results.  He’s been in this line of work for 10 years and considers protecting his crops from infestations that can affect them to be the most difficult part of it.  In his spare time he polishes wood to make boards thus earning extra money.  His greatest wish is to buy a car to transport his goods to market.

He is a member of the “Aroma de Café” (Aroma of Coffee) communal bank and this is the fourth loan with MFP where he hopes to get the financial help he so needs.  On the other hand, he commits once more to pay his installments like he’s done in previous loans.  Also, he enjoys being part of his communal bank because its members are responsible and very mutually supportive persons.

If Wilfredo were to obtain the support, he will use the requested funds to buy baskets and to pay the laborers who are helping him harvest the coffee their salaries.

loans.use: to buy baskets and pay laborers' salaries to help him bring in the harvest.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Gemma has operated a tailoring business for 3 years, sewing office and school uniforms. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop. Gemma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring shop

loans.name: Deogratias

texts.en:
Deogratias is 36 years old and married, with 4 children aged between 2 and 10 years old. He has no other dependents and lives in a semi-permanent house in Kibaale District, western Uganda.

Deogratias has been operating a store for 5 years and it has enabled him to buy a plot of land and build a semi-permanent house. He faces a challenge of high inflation rates. His desire is to own a wholesale business. Deogratias wants a loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: To buy soap and sugar to sell

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Leonida has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks. Leonida is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 40 years old and married with 2 children.  She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.  She has been farming rice for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising ducks.

Rebecca is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco tiene 34 años de edad, está casado con la Señora Natalia    hace más de 9 años  y vive en su casa propia en la ciudad de Carapeguá, tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar.
Él empezó hace más de 25  años a tejer las tradicionales sobrecamas y hamacas,  las que  lleva a vender por zonas  de Luque. Este oficio aprendió de su padre ya que el mismo se dedicaba al mismo rubro y le enseñó todo lo que sabía. Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudo comprarse dos motocicletas las cuales utiliza para realizar sus ventas, actualmente viaja en compañía de su esposa y juntos llevan a vender las artesanías de la zona a diversos lugares. Ya cuentan con clientela bien formada quienes gustan mucho de los productos que ofrecen. Comenta que trabaja arduamente por darle un buen futuro a sus hijos y a su esposa.
El solicita el crédito para la compra sobrecamas, hamacas y demás para abastecer su stock de mercaderías con lo cual podrá hacer frente a la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco is 34 years old and has been married to Natalia for more than 9 years. He lives in his own house in the city of Carapeguá, and they have 2 school-age children.

More than 25 years ago he began to weave traditional hammocks and quilts, which he brings to sell in areas around Luque. He learned this trade from his father, as he worked in this field and taught him everything he knew.

Thanks to his work and effort he was able to buy himself two motorcycles which he uses to make his sales He currently travels in the company of his wife, and together they bring the handicrafts of the area to sell in various places.

They already have a well-established clientele who really like the products that they offer.  He says that he works hard to provide a good future for his children and his wife. 

He is seeking credit to buy quilts, hammocks and more to stock up on merchandise with which he will be able to meet his customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy quilts, hammocks and more for resale.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Elna has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, and snacks. She has had this business for seven years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

Elna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit keeps livestock and has an orchard. Anahit would like to develop farming, for which she needs some financial investment. With the requested loan Anahit plans to purchase livestock. Farm development will allow Anahit improve her family's living conditions. Anahit lives together with her mother and daughter.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

loans.name: Sari

texts.en: Sari, 37, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Sari and her husband sell firewood, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 100 on food and USD 65 on the other necessary expenses. Sari is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase piglets to raise for sale. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise for sale

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Pacita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Pacita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Pacita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.en:
Adjowa operates a salon where people come to have their hair cut and styles.  She has 5 children and her family has lived in Elmina for about 30 years. 

Adjowa uses her income to see to the well-being of her home and family.  She will use the loan to buy hair, pomade, hair extensions and other supplies to make her customers happy.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjowa plans to buy a dryer.

loans.use: to buy hair, pomade, hair extensions and others to cut and style her customers hair.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 37 years old and is married to Ann. Together they have two children. He gets his income from rearing pigs. He has been in the business for the past seven years. He gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.

This is George's first loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase feed for his pigs and increase the number of piglets. He will use the anticipated profit to increase his poultry. His dream is to be able to pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es: Lita, de 34 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsables. Vive con su pareja con quien tiene cuatro hijos de 17, 14, 13 años y el menor de 7 meses en su casa propia, en donde comparten las alegrías y las tristezas todos juntos. Lita y su pareja trabajan mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El trabajo de Lita consiste en la crianza de animales de corral, posee un pequeño galpón de pollos en donde esta criando 200 unidades de pollos. Su conviviente trabaja en varias actividades y no tiene un ingresos fijo al mes, es por eso que ella decidió apoyar en los ingresos del hogar. Así se inicio con este pequeño proyecto que empezó como un pequeño pasatiempo, ahora significa para ella una forma de vida, ella trabaja sola, pero en algunas ocasiones tiene la ayuda de sus hijos los mayores. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le brinda independencia y facilidad de disponer de su propio horario, le esta yendo bien y espera poder seguir así, tiene como planes el de seguir creciendo y poner algunos galpones más. Este será el tercer crédito con la institución MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con sus cuotas, como en el anterior crédito que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas que son muy responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más pollitos, vacunas, vitaminas, alimentos balanceados y algunos materiales que necesita implementar para seguir con la crianza de pollos.
texts.en: Lita is 34 years old and is a good woman , kind and very responsible. She lives with her partner with whom she has 4 chldren aged 17, 14 and 13 years and 7 months. They live in their own house where they share the joys and sorrows of life together. Lita and her partner work hard to give their children a better quality of life. Lita raises poultry. She has a small chicken shed where she is raising 200 chickens. Her partner works at various jobs and does not have a fixed monthly income. This is why she decided to help with the household expenses. This is how she started this small project which initially began as a small hobby. Now, it is a way of life for her. She works alone but on occasion her older children help her. What she likes about her work is that it gives her independence and allows her to manage her own time. She is doing well and hopes to continue doing so. She plans on growing her business and setting up a few more chicken sheds. This will be her 3rd loan with MFP. She is very happy knowing that she will have financial support as in this way she will feel secure moving forwards with her business. On the other hand, she agrees once again to make her repayments, as she did with the previous loan she had. She also likes being a part of her communal bank as all the members are very responsible and very supportive people. With the amount requested, she will buy more chicks, vaccines, vitamins, balanced feed and a few materials she needs to continue raising chickens.

loans.use: to buy chicks, vaccines, vitamins, feed and other materials for her chicken shed.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
La señora Eloísa es socia del banco comunal Las Caribeñas, del Distrito Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos.
Con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 comenzó su pequeño negocio con algunos productos, los mas consumidos por la gente de este lugar, lo ha sabido manejar y ahora cuenta con una bodega bien surtida.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: ½ caja de jabón, 2 bolsas de detergente, 1 caja de añil, 1 caja de enjuague, 1 paquete de fideos, 1 paquete de harina, 5 casilleros de huevo, una caja de aceite.
Las mejoras que ha tenido en su casa han sido gracias a sus habilidades porque es la persona que está pendiente de ello, su esposo es maestro albañil y es quien realiza todo los arreglos en casa, de esa manera se ahorran en la mano de obra.
Agradece a Manuela Ramos por todo lo que ha podido conseguir y aprender de las demás personas que son un ejemplo de trabajo y dedicación.
texts.en:
Eloísa is a member of the communal bank Las Caribeñas, in the Manantay district, in the department of Ucayali. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 children.

With her first loan of 300 soles she began her small business with some products, mostly used by neighborhood people. She has known how to manage and now she has a well stocked store. With the new loan of 1,500 soles she will buy 1/2 of a box of soap, 2 bags of detergent, 1 box of laundry whitener, 1 box of rinse, 1 package of noodles, 1 package of flour, 5 cartons of eggs, and 1 box of oil.

The improvements that she has made to her home have been thanks to the workmanship of the person watching over it. Her husband is is master mason who makes all the repairs at home, and in this way she saves on labor costs.

She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for everything that she has gotten and learned from the other people that are an example of hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to buy 1/2 of a box of soap, 2 bags of detergent, and other supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, D. 52 años D. edad, es una mujer trabajadora y jovial, esta casada con José, viviendo solos en una casa D. su propiedad, ya que sus hijos tienes sus propias casas en donD. viven con sus respectivas familias, pero visitándoles seguidamente. La actividad que realiza María  es la venta D. gaseosas, para esto cuenta con una refrigeradora que compró con la ayuda D. su esposo, donD. guarda sus productos muy frías como les gusta a sus clientes, ya que esta actividad le resulta mas liviana por el problema D. salud que le aqueja en las piernas que no le permiten movilizarse con facilidad. Por ese motivo D. inició en ese negocio hace 5 años, realizándola sola pero sin mucho esfuerzo. Lo que le gusta D. su negocio es el contar con ingreso económico que le permite apoyar a su esposo con algunos gastos D. su hogar, así como los gastos D. su terapia para las piernas, ya que le diagnosticaron osteoporosis y le recomendaron caminar poco. Al contrario, lo que no le gusta D. su negocio es que depenD. D. clima caluroso, y cuando llueve y hace frió las ventas bajan. Por otro lado, tiene muchas ganas D. seguir avanzando y desea poder sanarse para retomar su negocio D. venta D. comidas ó abrir una bodega en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP,  está agradecida por la oportunidad D. contar con un préstamo para avanzar con su negocio, por eso cumplirá con el pago D. sus cuotas, como en anteriores prestamos. Además D. sentirse a gusto con su grupo, púes los considera buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado D. 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. bebidas gaseosas a menos precio en diferentes marcas y presentaciones, para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 52 years-old and a hardworking and cheerful woman. She is married to José and they live alone in a home on their property since their children have their own homes where they live with their respective families where they visit them often.

The activity that María performs is selling soda. For this she has a refrigerator that she bought with the help of her husband where she keeps her products very cold as her customers like them. This activity is easier for her because of the health problem that pains her legs and doesn't allow her to move about easily. For this reason she began her business five years ago, doing it alone but without a lot of effort.

What she likes about her business is having the financial income that allows her to support her husband with some household expenses, as well as with expenses for the therapy for her legs since she was diagnosed with osteoporosis and they recommended that she not walk much. On the contrary, what she doesn't like about her work is that it depends on the hot climate, and when it rains and is cold, her sales decrease. On the other hand, she has a great desire to continue advancing and wishes to be able to get healthy in order to take up her business of selling food or opening a grocery store in her home again.

This will be the sixth loan with the MFP institution. She is thankful for the opportunity to have a loan to advance her business. For this reason she will fulfill the payments of her installments like with previous loans. In addition to feeling pleased with her group, she considers them to be good people. With the requested total of 1500 nuevos soles, she will invest it in buying a greater quantity of soda at a smaller cost of different brands and presentations with which to supply her business.

loans.use: to buy more soda.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Evangeline makes and sells snacks such as rice and pan cakes. She has run this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.
Evangeline has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Cheryl works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cheryl is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy nets and other materials for her fishing business.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two school-age kids in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. Mom and her husband are local rice farmers who have recently finished collecting and threshing their rice. Besides farming, Mom’s husband takes some time to go through the village to buy recycled materials from the villagers and then sells them to its industry for profit. 

Currently, Mom is applying for a loan from HKL and Kiva for her husband to keep as capital to buy recycled materials. This loan will sustain and improve this business well. She is very happy and grateful. In the future, she hopes that she’ll be able to rebuild her house again and cover the roof with tiles.

loans.use: to keep as capital to buy recycled materials.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Rosalinda has a sari-sari store [food shop] that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rith would like to pay school fees for her sons

loans.name: Linus

texts.en:
Linus K. is 36-years old, married and has one child. Linus has no secondary school certificate, but when he came to Nairobi, he decided not to be idle. He first worked as a casual laborer for several construction firms. While working he managed to save Ksh 2,000.00 ($29), which he used to buy a shaving machine and some combs. Unfortunately he was dismissed from his casual duties after the construction firm closed its doors. He was then employed as a guard at Ayany estate, the up-market part of Kibera, where he saved Ksh 3,000.00 ($42). With this, he was able to rent a small room where he operates a barbershop. At night he works as a guard, and during the day he operates his barbershop. From the barbershop profits, he started a water-selling point (place to buy water). In 2005, Linus added two more water selling points. The Government of Kenya's vision is that by the year 2030, every Kenyan will have access to clean water. Linus' water-selling projects help provide clean and safe water to the residents of Kibera, which decreases water borne diseases by a big margin.

Being a very hard working and determined person with a vision of business expansion, Linus wants to start selling clean water ice cubes. These are rectangular-shaped ice blocks used mostly by shopkeepers and fishmongers as a cooling agent since they do not own refrigerators. Linus has the water and now needs the refrigeration to make the ice blocks.

Linus kindly requests a loan of $325, which will have a repayment period of 8 – 15 months. He will use this loan to purchase a deep freezer, sealing machine, and a cooler box to help him attain his vision. This will also enable him to employ more people to help him sell the ice, and create employment opportunities around his community.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer, sealing machine and a cooler box

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is married and has an 18 years old son. Her husband works in a factory but his salary is very low. In order to have some extra income to pay for household expenses and her son's school, Maria has been producing and selling flour tortillas for 5 years now. This is a popular dish in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, where she is originally from. To take advantage of the high demand, she sells door-to-door and she gained lots of customers.

At this time, Maria is requesting a loan of $250 that she will use to buy griddles that are needed to produce tortillas. This will allow her to increase her production and increase her sales. She commits to pay back the loan in 3 to 6 months.

You can help Maria, she only wants to continue working and is thankful for being part of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es casada y tiene un hijo de 18 años, su esposos es obrero en una fábrica pero el salario que recibe es muy bajo, por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para cubrir algunos de los gastos del hogar y de la escuela de su hijo, desde hace cinco años, Maria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas de harina, este es un producto muy consumido en Monterrey, Nuevo León, de donde es originaria, y aprovechando al alta demanda que tiene sale a vender casa por casa y ha estado ganado muchos clientes.

En estos momentos Maria solicita de un crédito por $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de comales que utiliza en la elaboración de las tortillas, esto le permitirá incrementar la producción y poder incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a Maria, ella solo quiere continuar trabajando y agradece que seas parte de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy griddles

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Mrs. María R. is 52 years old, and she is separated from her husband. She has 7 children, of whom only two still live with her, one age 18 and one age 14. They attend a public high school in the city. María tells us that they are very dedicated to their studies and are excellent students.

María is the owner of a grocery store which is located in her own home, and with her effort and dedication it is growing from day to day. She wishes to diversify her merchandise, so the requested loan will be used to purchase footwear to sell, which will be a long-term investment.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La Sra. María R. tiene 52 años, está separada del marido y tiene 7 hijos, de los cuales sólo dos viven con ella, una de 18 años y otra de 14 que están estudiando en un colegio público de la ciudad; María nos cuenta que ellas son muy dedicadas a sus estudios y excelentes alumnas.

María es dueña de una despensa que está ubicada en su propia casa, la que con esfuerzo y dedicación hace crecer día a día. Desea diversificar su mercadería por lo que el crédito solicitado destinará a la compra de calzados para la venta, la que será una inversión a largo plazo.

loans.use: to buy footwear to sell

loans.name: Made Wantri

texts.id:
In addition to their daily routine as homemakers, Balinese housewives typically have a second job to support their family's income. So does Made Wantry, the wife of Kadek Suparma who works as a rock-carying truck driver. Living in Tukadaya village that is very remote from the city helps her current pig farming business. Starting with 250,000 IDR (1USD ~ 9,000 IDR) borrowed from her brother/sister in-law, Made bought two piglets that she raised for three months and sold for 750,000 IDR. After subtracting the cost of animal feed for three months, Made earn a margin of 200,000 IDR. Albeit the small scale, Made is very excited to grow her business. With the loan from DINARI, she could pay off the money borrowed from her brother/sister in-law and bought additional three piglets. She has a high hope that with additional capital she could gain even better return, so she could further help her husband to pay for their children (one in elementary school and another one is still a toddler) and to cover their basic needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Di samping melakukan aktifitas rutin sebagai ibu rumah tangga, Ibu-ibu di Bali pada umumnya memiliki suatu pekerjaan sampingan untuk menambah pendapatan keluarganya. Begitu juga yang dilakukan oleh Made Wantri istri dari Kadek Suparma yang bekerja sebagai sopir Truk pengangkut batu ini, Tinggal Di Desa Tukadaya yang sangat jauh dari kota sangat mendukung usaha ternak babi yang sekarang ini sedang di tekuninya. Mulai dari modal yang hanya Rp 250.000 itupun hasil pinjaman dari kakak iparnya Made membeli 2 ekor bibit babi yang di peliharanya selama 3 bulan, yang kemudian laku dijual dengan harga Rp 750 000 .Setelah di hitung dan di potong biaya pakan yg dihabiskan selama 3 bulan Made mendapat kelebihan Rp 200 000. meskipun sedikit hasil yang diperoleh, Made tetap semangat untuk mengembangkan usahanya ini. Dengan pinjam dari DINARI sekarang Ia telah mampu mengembalikan uang kakak iparnya dan membeli lagi bibit babi sebanyak 3 ekor besar harapan Made dengan tambahan modal ini akan memperoleh hasil yang lebih baik, sehingga dapat membantu suaminya dalam membiayai seorang anaknya yg duduk disekolah dasar dan satu lagi yg masih balita, disamping juga untuk biaya kebutuhan sehari-hari.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Ziya

texts.en: Ziya R. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-west Azerbaijan. He is 37 years old,  married and has 2 children. Ziya rents a food-market in the Beylagan city bazaar. He has one employee. Ziya wants to borrow $1200 so that he can buy more kind of goods and expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his food market business

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en: Vidadi (his sister is pictured) is married and has 3 children.  This 37-year-old man lives with his family in the Salyan region in the village of Yenikand.  He has run his farming business for 10 years.  Now, he requests a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer for improving his farming business in order to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Mrs. Felipa Champi lives in her own home in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz with her husband, Mr. Mario Calle, and their two children. Felipa is employed by a public works microbusiness, and her husband is employed as an independent construction worker.

With previous loans Felipa stabilized her land and built two rooms.

The loan she is seeking is to be used to demolish an old room that is located in the back part of the house and then to construct a new room. This is the sixth time that she seeks a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies them favorably to receive a loan. The five previous loans have been repaid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Felipa C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Mario Calle y sus dos hijos. La señora Felipa trabaja como obrera en una microempresa de obras publicas, y su esposo es empleado constructor independiente.

Con anteriores créditos la señora Felipa realizo el trabajo de estabilización de su terreno y la construcción de dos habitaciones.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la demolición de una habitación antigua que se encuentra en la parte de atrás de la casa y construcción de una nueva habitación. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Los cinco préstamos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: Demolition of an old room and construction of a new one.

loans.name: Dev Maiya

texts.en:
Miss Dev Maiya M. is a 50 year old lady who lives in Thecho village. Thecho is one of the underdeveloped villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She lives with her father, mother and her brother. Ms.Dev Maiya M. and her brother opened their shop 10 years ago. They sell different types of steel goods such as jugs, plates, water carrying pots, etc. from their shop. Income from the shop is the only source of income for their family.

Now Dev Maiya M. is requesting a loan of Rs 15000 to expand their business and buy necessary items for their shop.

loans.use: To buy goods items for her shop

loans.name: Kiyinki B1 East C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Topista M.. She is currently in the business of farming and is requesting a loan to purchase more farm equipment. Topista is 47 years old and is a widow. She has 8 children ranging from age 13 to 23 and her children go to school. Each week, Topista makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her workers. Topista has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Topista is joined in her small group by Samiya Z., Joyce O., Betty N., and Jane N.. Samiya Z. has a business in clothing sales and wants to boost business. Joyce O. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to stock more commodities. Betty N. operates a business selling rice and wants to add more capital. Jane N. is currently in the business of selling produce and is requesting a loan to expand business.

loans.use: To add working capital to farming business

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity O. is a married mother of five. She is 43years of age. Charity sells foodstuffs and drinks in her local community. She has been in this business since the year 2000. She hails from Lambe community Ogun State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client and has been a member for the past 4years. She needs the loan of $1200 to enable her to buy more gallons of red oil, vegetable oil and 6 crates of drinks. With this she hopes to serve her customers better. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy gallons of red oil, groundnut oil and drinks.

loans.name: Christina's Amani Group

texts.en:
Christina is a married woman with 1 child, age 11 years old. Christina owns a small salon, which she started in 1998. Every day, she works from 8 am to 8.30 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Janeth, Rose, Nai and Ruth, who have businesses dealing in shops, groceries and in block sales.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Hello from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Grace M.. She is widowed, and has two children aged 5 and 14. In 2005, Grace established her batik business. Grace requires a loan in order to purchase additional stock of batik. In the future. Grace plans to increase the quantity and variely of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock of traditional cloth.

loans.name: Mujeres Fuertes Group

texts.en:
Micheline Metellus is a young and highly-motivated female entrepreneur.  Returning to our organization, Esperanza, to receive her second loan, she has proven that she not only has the ability to payback loans on time, but also that she is able to use loans to make significant improvements in her life.  Selling pants, shirts, and blouses from her home, Micheline has been able to acquire inventory to establish this small business.  She has also begun to save for the first time in her life.  She plans to use her second loan to buy clothes in bulk from the nearby city of Santiago.  Micheline said that her business is more important to her than ever now that she has her first child, a three-month-old girl, to care for.

Micheline leads a five-person group, Las Mujeres Fuertes.  Each of these Haitian entrepreneurs lives in the Dominican Republic and supports the others so that each can access funding that they would never be able to receive on their own.  The purpose of their group loan is reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments so that all may receive their next loan together.  These women have found work here in the Dominican  Republic so that they can send money back to their families in Haiti.  One of the women is running a small salon, one makes empenadas on the street, and the two others others sell clothing similar to Micheline.

On behalf of Micheline, Las Mujeres Fuertes, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the issue of global poverty, and for your commitment to make a difference.

loans.use: To buy pants, blouses and shirts in Santiago for resale in Puerto Plata.

loans.name: Lun

texts.en: Mr. Lun C. is 69 years old and lives in Bang Village in Kandal Province. He and his wife, Mrs. Sok Chiv, are farmers. They have a child who is employed in a garment factory. Since their child’s work place is far from their home, Mr. Lun C. spends a lot of money on his child's commute. That is why Mr. Lun C. decided to ask for a loan which he will combine with his saving to buy a new motorbike for his child to use to commute to and from work. The motorbike will mean a big reduction in his family's expenses.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for his child to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Dinka

texts.en:
Dinka is from Banovići village. She is married and her husband works in a coal mine, earning about 800 KM monthly. They have one child, six years old.

This is Dinka's first loan at WWI, in the amount of 1000 KM. She wants to start selling used clothes and her big wish is to expand this business and to have something to do while her husband is at work.

loans.use: To buy used clothes.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara  es propietaria de un motocarro, pero al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene tres hijos menores, que estudian, su esposo Pedro es el chofer del motocarro y es quien se dedica al cuidado de su herramienta de trabajo, en el futuro desean que sus hijos sean profesionales, es por eso que trabajan arduamente.Sara requiere de una suma de dinero, que invertirá en el mantenimiento y arreglo de su motocarro y para alquilar un local la para su venta de ropa. Apoyemos a esta madre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.
texts.en:
Sara is the owner of a three-wheeler van; she sells clothing and takes care of her three young children, who are studying. Her husband Pedro both drives and takes care of the three-wheeler. They both work hard to give their children the chance to have successful professional lives when they grow up. Sara needs money to invest in the maintenance and repair of her van. She will also use the money to a rent space for selling her clothing. Let’s support this mother and worker who, with effort and dedication, works hard to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by PULP Translators, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairing her three-wheeler van, and renting a space to sell her clothing.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores de los Próceres”, ubicado en la calle 20 Mz. 27 Lt. 7 AA.HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre de2 hijos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja como vendedor de ripio y arena. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de  Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de carbón.

En la actualidad cuenta con una pequeña bodega en casa, para lo cual se levanta temprano para atender a sus hijos y luego ir al mercado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará ½ saco de azúcar y arroz, un paquete de fideos, una caja de leche, golosinas, carbón y verduras.

Rosa se siente feliz y agradecida por la ayuda brindada en Manuela Ramos ya que su estabilidad económica ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Rosa belongs to “Las Flores de los Próceres” (The Flowers of the National Heroes) Communal Bank located on 20 Mz. 27 Lt. 4AA. HH Primavera Segunda Etapa, in the Callería district in the Coronel Portillo province in the Ucayali department. She is 34 years old, the mother of two young children, married, and her husband works selling gravel and sand. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she invested in charcoal sales. Currently, she has a grocery store in her home, where she rises early to tend to her children and later go to the market. With this loan of $325, which she will repay in four months, she will buy 1/2 a sack of sugar and rice, a package of noodles, a box of milk, candy, charcoal, and vegetables. Rosa is happy and grateful for the help that Manuela Ramos has provided. Her financial situation has already improved.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, noodles, milk, candy, charcoal, and vegetables

loans.name: Hiek

texts.en: Mrs. Hiek P. is a villager in the Trapaing Lech village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice on it to earn a living. In addition to growing rice, she sells chickens. The chicken business is doing very well and she would like to expand by purchasing more chickens with the loan she is now requesting. She is a 49 year old widow with five children; one child sells chickens, three are laborers and the youngest is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam N. is a villager in Khvet Village in Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectar of land which she cultivates rice to earn a living. On her plantation, she faces a small problem because her soil is infertile and the rice crop is not plentiful. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sam N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil and improve her crop output. Her husband, Mr. Hean Heng, helps her on the plantation.

Mrs. Sam N. is 26-years-old and the mother of four children. Two are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the soil and make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa A. is married and has 5 dependents. She has received no formal education. Theresa sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Elmina, which she has done since 1998. Her husband is a businessman.

Theresa uses her income to help her husband in paying rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Theresa will use the loan to increase her working capital so as to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her profit margin so as to meet the financial needs of her large family.

loans.use: to increase her working capital to buy fish in larger quantities

loans.name: Dienaba

texts.fr: Dienaba B. est mariée, mère de 4 enfants scolarisés. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité de vente d’huile et de sucre. Elle s’approvisionne en gros chez un fournisseur de la place qui lui fait la livraison à domicile où elle exerce son commerce. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie et de contribuer à la prise en charge sanitaire de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dienaba B. is married and the mother of 4 children, all in school. She would like to use this loan to bolster her little business selling oil and sugar. She buys wholesale from a supplier in town who delivers to her at home, where she has her little business. Her goal is to improve living conditions and support and promote the health of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling oil and sugar out of her home

loans.name: Zulma Xiomara

texts.es: Zulma Xiomara C. S., reside en Armenia departamento de Sonsonate, junto a su esposo, Gerson Chávez de 34 años de edad, trabajan en conjunto para poder brindarle un mejore estilo de vida a su pequeña hija  Koni C. de 6 años de edad. Zulma trabaja a diario para poder brindarle todo lo necesario a su hijita como lo es educación alimento y vestuario. Es por eso que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cuál pueda aumentar los productos de su negocio, el cuál consiste en una tienda de productos perecederos, cabe mencionar que esta tienda la tiene desde hace cuatro años. Zulma desea aumentar los productos de la tienda de manera que sus ingresos familiares sean mayores a los actuales.
texts.en:
Zulma Xiomara C. S. resides in Armenia in the department of Sonsonate with her husband Gerson Chávez who is 34 years old. Zulma and Gerson work together to be able to offer a better lifestyle to their young daughter Koni C. who is 6 years old. Zulma works daily to be able to give everything necessary, in the way of education, food, and clothing, to her young daughter. For this reason she is requesting a loan through which she may be able to increase the number of products in her business which consists of a store of where she sells perishable goods. She mentions that she has had this store for the past 4 years. Zulma wishes to increase her store inventory so that her family income will be greater than what it currently is.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase new products for her business.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Hidaya S. from Mwanza. She is married with three children between the ages of two and thirteen. Hidaya has been running a tailoring business since 2004. Her business is making clothes, especially for women. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week. Hidaya currently earns about $80 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $325 USD to buy materials to make women clothes for resale. In the future, she plans to increase her efforts on her clothing business. Hidaya thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials to make women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
This young man was born in 1983. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. He is single. Three years ago he started this business.

Rasim repairs tires. He is enjoying his business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the necessary things for repairing tires and twenty tires for sale so that he will be able to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary things for repairing tires and  20 tires for sale

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 56 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene su casa propia en el distrito de Ventanilla, donde vive con su esposa y sus hijos. Desde muy joven incursionó en gran cantidad de trabajos, aprendiendo en uno de ellos a conducir, y desde entonces su meta fue tener un carrito propio, es así que con el esfuerzo de muchos años de trabajo logró comprar un camión con el cual trabaja actualmente dedicado al servicio de transporte de carga. El trabajo es duro, ya que suele salir desde tempranas horas de la mañana y terminar muy tarde por la noche, felizmente no está solo, pues tiene a su lado a su esposa, quien es el motor de su hogar y quien lo apoya incondicionalmente, sabe que juntos podrán lograr todos sus objetivos, ya que tienen muchas ganas y siempre ponen lo mejor de sí en cada cosa que hacen. Roberto se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP, y promete ser muy puntual en sus pagos, porque sabe que se está comprometiendo con una gran responsabilidad, él agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito y lo acercan más a sus objetivos. Con el dinero está solicitando refaccionará su camión y dará la cuota inicial para la adquisición de otro camión, el cual le permita mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Roberto is a very hard-working 56-year-old man. He lives with his wife and children in their own home in the Ventanilla district. He began working when he was very young and has had a variety of jobs. At one of his jobs, he learned to drive, and since then he has had the goal of having his own car. After many years of hard work he was finally able to buy a truck, which he now uses to transport cargo. The work is difficult, as he usually has to leave very early in the morning and finishes late at night. Happily, he doesn't work alone, as his wife is by his side. She is the driving force behind their home, and supports him unconditionally. Roberto knows that together they can achieve all their dreams, as they are very motivated and always do their best in everything they do.

This is Roberto's first loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and he promises to be punctual with its repayment. He knows that this is a great responsibility, and he is grateful to all those who are making this loan possible and helping him get closer to his goals. He will use this loan to refurbish his truck and to put a down payment on another one, which will increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish his truck

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, she owns and operates a furniture-making business. Most of her income comes from making and selling general household furniture to community members. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over two years.

Marilou joined ASKI (one of Kiva's field partners) to gain access to financial services that would give her the ability to engage in business activities and thereby improve her living situation.  Marilou is requesting a loan that will be used to purchase materials needed for making additional furniture. She plans to use the revenue generated from this loan to further develop her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the pioneer micro-finance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Millicent Auma

texts.en:
Millicent is the 40-year-old mother of three children. She is raising them by herself as her husband passed away. She sells clothes in Kisumu, just off the main street. She hopes to expand her business and make enough profit to purchase a cow. The cow will serve as both an extra source of food as well as a buffer against food insecurity should she face it in the future. 

In this video, you can hear the interviewer greet Millicent saying “Idhi Nade”, which is Luo for “How are you?” Millicent responds, “Adhi maber,” meaning “very good.” Most people living in Kisumu descend from the Luo tribe, the same tribe as Obama’s father. At the end, you will hear the interviewer fluctuate between Kiswahili and Luo saying “Asante Sana” in Kiswahili, meaning “thank you” and “Erokamano”, which in Luo means “thank you.” The voices in the background are people coming for a weekly K-MET borrower meeting. To see what one looks like, check out the first video in this blog post: http://fellowsblog.kiva.org/2009/05/14/m-banking/

K-MET, the NGO distributing the loan, is unique in that it is not a traditional MFI. Rather, it is a development corporation focused on raising health standards in Kenya. You can read more about K-MET’s work here: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=24

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Vegetable vending is the business managed by Florentina N. of Barangay San Jose Norte 1 of Mallig, Isabela. Florentina is 50 years old, married, and has three children. Her youngest child is the only one who continued her education. Her older two children are both working in Manila at the moment and assist her with some of the needs at home.

Florentina is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 as additional working capital for her vegetable-vending business. She is thankful that she has her vending stall in front of her house so that she does not have to roam from one house to another to sell her produce. She hopes that her business will grow further and become productive in the future through patience and the financial support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Kutimuy que significa Regresa en quechua.
Aurea es soltera, tiene 59 años y 3 hijos, Aurea vende refrescos que ella misma prepara, sus ventas son de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Aurea junto a sus hijos realizan artesanía en piedra de Huamanga, sus productos los vende en los mercados.
Aurea necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de piedra de Huamanga.
Los sueños de Aurea son progresar con su negocio y que sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
Aurea is a member of the communal bank “Kutimuy”. “Kutimuy” means “return” in Quechua. Aurea is single. She is 59 years old and has three children. Aurea sells cold drinks that she prepares herself. She sells them everyday by moving around the Santa Clara market. Also, Aurea, along with her children, makes folk-art from the stone from Huamanga. The folk-art she also sells in the markets. Aurea needs a loan of 1,000 soles that she will use to invest in more of the stone from Huamanga. Aurea dreams of progressing with her business and also that her children are successful.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stone from Huamanga

loans.name: Mornh

texts.en:
Mornh R. is 33 years old and is the mother of four kids. She is married to Mork Kek, 43, who works at fishing in and around the lakes of their community.

Mornh R. has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for more than nine years. She sells fish that she gets fR. her husband’s fishing or buys them fR. her wholesale supplier and other fishermen.

Mornh R. finds it hard, transporting fish to sell at the market, because she doesn’t have her own vehicle and she hopes to buy one. Due to the lack of money, she requested a loan to add to her savings to buy a used motorcycle which she will use for picking up fish and for her family's traveling needs.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle for picking up fish and for her family's traveling needs

loans.name: Ericka Zulema

texts.es:
la Sra. ERIKA ZULEMA M. AGUILAR se dedica al comercio , ella tiene una pequeña venta de ropa,cosmeticos y variedades de uso personal de mujeres.
su negocio le permite generar ingresos para  cubrir algunos gastos del hogar y compromisos que tiene, de esta forma ayuda a su esposo con los gastos y la alimentacion de su hijo, Ellos
se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante.
Su esposo Juan Pablo se dedica a la caficultura y la ganaderia, ya que Danli es una zona apta para dicha actividad economica, doña Erika ha sabido ganarse la clientela que hoy en dia tiene ya que cuando no van a comprar a la tienda la visitan personalmente en su casa facilitandoles de esta manera ahorro de tiempo y dinero, esto le favorece a ella ya que coloca su mercaderia mas facilmente generandole mayores ventas aun cuando es temporada baja. 
esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio y asi satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora ERIKA ZULEMA M. AGUILAR has a business selling clothing, cosmetics, and various personal items for women. Her business lets her generate income to cover some costs of her home and obligations that she has. In this way, she helps her husband with the costs of raising their son. They mutually support one another to get ahead. Her husband, Juan Pablo, grows coffee and raises livestock. Danli is a good area for this economic activity. Erika has learned how to grow her clientele, who today no longer go to the store to buy, but now come to visit her personally in her home because it saves them time and money. This works well for her because she can lay out her merchandise more easily and generate better sales, even in the off season. She is requesting a loan to supply her business and to satisfy her customers' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair accessories, earrings, creams, towels, perfumes, lotions, hangers, powders, and jeans

loans.name: New Life Group

texts.en:
New Life is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Yassa E., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Yassa is married with 3 children, ages 4-12.  The oldest child is in the 4th grade because school was interrupted during the war.  Yassa is 26 years old, illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Yassa runs a soap production business, both producing and selling it in the Bokeza market.  She has been running her business for 5 years, and with the loan from LEAP, she will purchase raw materials for making soap such as custy soda, fuel, palm oil.  This will allow her to grow her inventory in order to meet the demand.  Yassa  is successful because of excellent products and customer service.  With the profits she will build a permanent shop in town and save for her children’s education.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to produce soap

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita manages a simple village store, while her husband, Jayson, works as an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker) in Dubai. She is a responsible housewife living in Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 28 years old and a high school graduate. Rita is very determined to work so that she can help her husband earn a living. They strive to uplift their poor living conditions and save money for the welfare of their child.

With her husband’s remittance from abroad, Rita was able to put up the store, and she uses most of her income as rolling capital. Wanting to increase her income, she is now requesting financial assistance from Kiva lenders. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 as business capital. She hopes that, with this loan, her business will continuously progress.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Julia Patricia

texts.es: Doña Julia S. de 45 años de edad, reside en el barrio la primavera en la capital de Managua,  con tres hijos que estudian,  se desempeña como docente desde  hace quince años, el cual se graduó  en la normal y pudo a mucho esfuerzo sacar su licenciatura. Pero su mayor deseo es poder tener su propio negocio para mejorar la economía de su familia, y poder dar estudios a sus tres hijos para que gocen de  mayores oportunidades. Con este crédito es su segundo ciclo el cual comprara materiales de construcción para hacer y poner un inodoro para estar en una higiene mejor. Da las gracias Afodenic por el beneficio que obtendrá con este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Julia S. is 45 years old and lives in the La Primavera neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She has three children who are in school. She has been employed as a teacher for 15 years; after graduating from the teacher training school she put much effort into getting her license. But her biggest wish is to be able to have her own business to improve the economic situation of her family, and allow her three children to get a good education so that they can enjoy better opportunities. With this loan, which will be her second loan cycle, she will buy construction materials so that she can put in a new toilet for improved hygiene. She is grateful to AFODENIC for the benefits that she will obtain through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to put in a new toilet

loans.name: Wanayezee Group

texts.en:
Wanayezee is a group of 5 borrowers led by Luyakoi K., 30 years old, married with 2 children aged 1 and 3 years old;  the kids are not yet in school. She is an illiterate due to poverty. Luyakoi and her family live in the Ziggida Town, a small town close Zorzor, a district in Lofa county, northern Liberia.

Luyakoi’s business is her palm oil sales. She buys palm oil from farmers wholesale and sells it retail in bottles to residents of Ziggida town Lofa County, northern Liberia. She has been running this business for 2 years and is hoping to improve to a bigger table. She talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Luyakoi and her family depend on this business for their daily needs, therefore; she needs this loan in order to purchase more palm oil wholesale to improve business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house of their own.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil wholesale to improve business.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: El señor Norberto S.,  tiene la edad e 47 años,  habita en la Borgoña ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual vende comida los fines de semana para apoyarlo con los gastos del pago de agua, luz, y los alimentos que hagan falta, ellos tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya son casado y un joven de 18 años que actualmente estudia su secundaria, los planes hacia su familia es lograr comprar un terreno  para heredarle a cada uno de ellos. Don Norberto desde hace 25 años trabaja como agricultor  ya que con sus propios esfuerzos logro comprar un terreno y trabajar por si solo, agradece a la institución por la buena aprobación de su segundo crédito y por la asistencia técnica, lo cual le ayudo a tener una mejor producción y pagar el préstamo en tiempo y forma. Tiene una comioneta que compro para poder trasladar sus frutos al centro del mayoreo que es donde entrega la piña, un mercado central.Con este préstamo comprara fertilizantes para mejorar la producción de piña y poder vender a buen precio.
texts.en:
Mr. Norberto S. is 47 years old and lives in Borgona in the municipality of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife who sells food on weekends to help him with the costs of paying for water, electricity and the food they need. They have three children, two of whom are already married and a young man of 18 who is currently studying in high school. Mr. Noberto's plan for his family is to buy land for each of his children. Mr. Norberto has been working for 25 years as a farmer, and by his own efforts, he strives to buy land and work on it. He thanks the institution for the proper approval of his second loan and the technical assistance, which helped him to improve production. He promises to repay the loan in a timely manner. He also has a van, which he purchased to deliver his fruits such as pineapple at the central market.
