With this loan, he plans to buy fertilizer in order to improve production of his pineapples and sell them at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his pineapples in order to have a better harvest

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 44 year widowed mother of with five children.  They are ages 14 to 25.  Three go to school.  She rents a two room house where she stays with six people. Regina takes care of additional family members. They have access to electricity but no piped water.  They eat two meals a day.   

She spend money to get to and from work, near the outskirts of Kampala.  She serves an average of 20 customers a day, seven days a week and sells second-hand clothes, door to door.  Her major challenges include buying second hand clothes, because prices are rising and the rainy season which slows sales.  

Her monthly expenses include feeding the family, medication and rent.  She's been in this business for twenty years and with MCDT for five years.  She is servicing her tenth loan.  Regina joined MCDT because it was near her home and easy to work with.  She wants to use this loan to buy bales of second hand clothes. She hopes to sell wholesale only and to own a permanent business premise.

loans.use: Buy bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ingredients she can cook in her cafe.

loans.name: Rosalinda Matea

texts.es: Doña Rosalinda R. tiene 30 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Artesana,  “Elaboración de Fajas Típicas”, habita junto  a sus Hijos, ella se dedica en la Artesanía, llevan  tiempo 8  años de Laborar,   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Xecaja del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento y municipio de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella  pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rosalinda R., 30, is married and she's an artisan. She makes typical sashes. She lives with her children and has been in this line of work for 8 years. She lives in Paraje Xecaja, which is in the Poxlajuj territory of the department and municipality of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently, demand for her wares has increased but her economic situation does not permit her to increase her capital. For this reason, she has called upon Asociación ASDIR to request financing to buy raw materials with which to increase her sales hoping, thereby, to help her family get ahead in life and to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Seba

texts.en: Seba has worked in cosmetics and beauty products sales since 2008 to earn income to help her family. During this period, she was able to make a good number of customers. Today, Seba is requesting to borrow $700 to buy more products for her clientele and to increase her sales and thus, her income.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa S. est âgée 41 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE depuis 3 ans. Elle fait de l'embouche Bovine depuis plus de 2 ans. Grâce à cette activité elle parvient à subvenir à ses besoins personnels et à participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Awa S. is a 41-year-old married mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" (Village loan group) of Palene for 3 years. She has raised cattle for more than 2 years. Thanks to this activity, she is able to meet her own needs and participate in the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her self-financing capability

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math S. is a 30-year old single woman. She was once married but she divorced years ago. She currently lives with her younger sister and brother-in-law in a wooden house in Phnom Penh city. 
To make a living, S. sells mens' and womens' clothes in the local market. S. is a good salesperson because she is skilled in public communication. Her store is very busy and she has many clients. S. is applying for a loan so that she can take advantage of lower bulk prices by buying large quantities of clothing for resale.

loans.use: To increaes her inventory of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Chetchie

texts.en: To make a living, Chetchie Q. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in her community. She is 26 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Pangantucan, Bukidnon. Chetchie has been in her business for over one year and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Chetchie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to invest in expanding her business. Chetchie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will again be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Fatou Ngom

texts.fr: Fatou Ngom S. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis 6 ans et y a bénéficié de 12 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle développe un petit commerce de mil et fait parallèlement de l'embouche bovine. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou Ngom S. is a 60-year old woman who is married and has four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NGOHE for six years and has benefited from 12 loans, which she has managed well and repaid on time. She is building up a small business selling millet and at the same time has a beef fattening activity. She supports her husband in taking care of their family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote her income-generating activity

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana, 31, is a rice farmer in Norala, South Cotabato. Her business is a big help to her family. It provides their daily food and helps them repay the amount borrowed from Community Economic Ventures, Inc.

Rosana is a mother of two children, the eldest 4 years old. She lacks capital to provide all the supplies needed for her farm, which is why she sought help from CEVI and asked for a loan of 15,000 PHP. This will really help her business venture.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Vutha Chaut, live in a small village off of National Road number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1993, and have three sons. Two of them are in school and the other one is still young. 

Chanthorn is a garment factory worker. Her husband has been a truck driver for more than five years. Because she does not have her own restroom, she has to ask her sister to use hers very often. Facing this problem, Chanthorn is requesting a loan of $300 to build her own one.

loans.use: To build a restroom for her family's use.

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
Felismina S. nasceu no Distrito de Moamba, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 57 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos de 35, 30, 27 e 23 anos de idade, todos já não vão a escola. Fez somente 3ą classe não continuou porque os pais não tinham condições financeiras e priorizaram mais trabalho de produção de comida. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Moamba para Maputo devido a Guerra de desestabilização que assolou também aquele Distrito. Tem um negócio próprio há mais de 20 anos, possui 1 empregado que lhe auxilia no seu negócio e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 20.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum nas suas contas bancárias (Millenium Bim e Standard Bank).
Já teve empréstimos na Associação de crédito Malengane, mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (carne, temperos, arroz, refrescos, cervejas, e outros) para aumentar e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. Um dos seus maiores projectos é inaugurar o seu novo estabelecimento e oferecer cada vez mais melhores serviços a sua clientela. Pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no desenvolvimento do seu negócio.
texts.en:
Felismina S. was born in Moamba District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 57, widowed, and has 4 children who are 35, 30, 27 and 23 years old. None of them are going to school. Felisima only finished third grade and did not continue because her parents could not afford it and focused more on work that produced food. She lives in her own house with her children and supports two relatives (nieces or nephews) who live with her. She left Moamba for Maputo because of the civil war that also ravaged that District. For more than 20 years, she has had her own business. She has one employee who helps her with her business, and she earns about 20,000 meticais per month. She uses this for household expenses and even saves some in her bank accounts (at Millenium Bim and Standard Bank). Felisima has had loans before with Malengane Credit Union, but she decided not to continue with them. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This 25,000 meticais loan is her first; she will use it to buy products (meat, spices, rice, soft drinks, beer, and other products) to increase and diversify her merchandise. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out other loans. One of her biggest projects is to open her new shop and offer better service to her customers. She intends to ask for more loans to use for the growth of her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (meat, spices, rice, soft drinks, beer and other products)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Nurzhamal's Group

texts.en:
Nurzhamal Z. is the leader of the group, she is 28 years old. Her husband works as a bus driver. They have a two-year-old son. Nurzhamal stays at home and takes care of her son. Nurzhamal owns a piece of land. In order to make some money she cultivates fruits and vegetables. She has been doing this work for a long time. When her husband is free, he helps her with the farming activities. The initial investment in this business was 3000 soms (65.28$) and now she makes 5000 soms (108.8$) per month. With money received from the loan Nurzhamal wants to purchase another piece of land for 6000 soms (130.57$). In the future she plans to repair the house.

Gulmerahon S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 43 and married. She has two sons and a daughter. In order to earn some money the older son went to work in Russia and the daughter studies at school. Gulmerahon sells convenience and stationery goods near the school. She also helps her husband in breeding cattle. They started breeding cattle 19 years ago, with the initial investment of 8000 soms (174$). Now they make 4000 soms (87$) per month. With money received from the loan, Gulmerahon wants to purchase a calf for breeding. In future she plans to buy a piece of land, to save some money to contribute to her son's wedding, and build a new house for him.

Munirahon R. is 28 years old. Her husband provides tractor and combine services. In order to make money Mubirahon and her husband breed cattle. They also sow wheat and potatoes. They have been doing this work for 10 years. The initial investment in that business activity was 3000 soms (65.28$) and now Mubirahon makes 5000 soms (108.8$) per month. She wants to get a loan to purchase a bull for breeding and fattening. In the future she plans to build a new house and to increase the number of cattle.

Ilham K. is 25 years old. He breeds poultry and cattle. His mom sells milk to make some money. Ten years ago, having sold some cattle, they started their business activity. The initial investment was 10000 soms (216.6$) and now Ilham makes 8000 soms (174$) per month. With money received from the loan, he will purchase a cow for breeding and fertilizers for farming. In the future, Ilham plans to purchase a piece of land, build a new house and to repair the parents' house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land for farming.
